    4413                 :             :     /// @return tgeEnd End time of TGE
    4414                 :             :     /// @return vestingEnd End time of the vesting period

    4417                 :             : 
    4418                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/oapp-evm/contracts/oapp/libs/OAppOptionsType3.sol
    4419                 :             : 
    4420                 :             : /**
    4421                 :             :  * @title OAppOptionsType3
    4422                 :             :  * @dev Abstract contract implementing the IOAppOptionsType3 interface with type 3 options.
    4423                 :             :  */
    4424                 :             : abstract contract OAppOptionsType3 is IOAppOptionsType3, Ownable {
    4425                 :             :     uint16 internal constant OPTION_TYPE_3 = 3;
    4426                 :             : 
    4427                 :             :     // @dev The "msgType" should be defined in the child contract.
    4428                 :             :     mapping(uint32 eid => mapping(uint16 msgType => bytes enforcedOption)) public enforcedOptions;
    4429                 :             : 
    4430                 :             :     /**
    4431                 :             :      * @dev Sets the enforced options for specific endpoint and message type combinations.
    4432                 :             :      * @param _enforcedOptions An array of EnforcedOptionParam structures specifying enforced options.
    4433                 :             :      *
    4434                 :             :      * @dev Only the owner/admin of the OApp can call this function.
    4435                 :             :      * @dev Provides a way for the OApp to enforce things like paying for PreCrime, AND/OR minimum dst lzReceive gas amounts etc.
    4436                 :             :      * @dev These enforced options can vary as the potential options/execution on the remote may differ as per the msgType.
    4437                 :             :      * eg. Amount of lzReceive() gas necessary to deliver a lzCompose() message adds overhead you dont want to pay
    4438                 :             :      * if you are only making a standard LayerZero message ie. lzReceive() WITHOUT sendCompose().
    4439                 :             :      */
    4440                 :           0 :     function setEnforcedOptions(EnforcedOptionParam[] calldata _enforcedOptions) public virtual onlyOwner {
    4441                 :           0 :         _setEnforcedOptions(_enforcedOptions);
    4442                 :             :     }
    4443                 :             : 
    4444                 :             :     /**
    4445                 :             :      * @dev Sets the enforced options for specific endpoint and message type combinations.
    4446                 :             :      * @param _enforcedOptions An array of EnforcedOptionParam structures specifying enforced options.
    4447                 :             :      *
    4448                 :             :      * @dev Provides a way for the OApp to enforce things like paying for PreCrime, AND/OR minimum dst lzReceive gas amounts etc.
    4449                 :             :      * @dev These enforced options can vary as the potential options/execution on the remote may differ as per the msgType.
    4450                 :             :      * eg. Amount of lzReceive() gas necessary to deliver a lzCompose() message adds overhead you dont want to pay
    4451                 :             :      * if you are only making a standard LayerZero message ie. lzReceive() WITHOUT sendCompose().
    4452                 :             :      */
    4453                 :           0 :     function _setEnforcedOptions(EnforcedOptionParam[] memory _enforcedOptions) internal virtual {
    4454                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = 0; i < _enforcedOptions.length; i++) {
    4455                 :             :             // @dev Enforced options are only available for optionType 3, as type 1 and 2 dont support combining.
    4456                 :           0 :             _assertOptionsType3(_enforcedOptions[i].options);
    4457                 :           0 :             enforcedOptions[_enforcedOptions[i].eid][_enforcedOptions[i].msgType] = _enforcedOptions[i].options;
    4458                 :             :         }
    4459                 :             : 
    4460                 :           0 :         emit EnforcedOptionSet(_enforcedOptions);
    4461                 :             :     }
    4462                 :             : 
    4463                 :             :     /**
    4464                 :             :      * @notice Combines options for a given endpoint and message type.
    4465                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    4466                 :             :      * @param _msgType The OAPP message type.
    4467                 :             :      * @param _extraOptions Additional options passed by the caller.
    4468                 :             :      * @return options The combination of caller specified options AND enforced options.
    4469                 :             :      *
    4470                 :             :      * @dev If there is an enforced lzReceive option:
    4471                 :             :      * - {gasLimit: 200k, msg.value: 1 ether} AND a caller supplies a lzReceive option: {gasLimit: 100k, msg.value: 0.5 ether}
    4472                 :             :      * - The resulting options will be {gasLimit: 300k, msg.value: 1.5 ether} when the message is executed on the remote lzReceive() function.
    4473                 :             :      * @dev This presence of duplicated options is handled off-chain in the verifier/executor.
    4474                 :             :      */
    4475                 :           0 :     function combineOptions(
    4476                 :             :         uint32 _eid,
    4477                 :             :         uint16 _msgType,
    4478                 :             :         bytes calldata _extraOptions
    4479                 :             :     ) public view virtual returns (bytes memory) {
    4480                 :           0 :         bytes memory enforced = enforcedOptions[_eid][_msgType];
    4481                 :             : 
    4482                 :             :         // No enforced options, pass whatever the caller supplied, even if it's empty or legacy type 1/2 options.
    4483                 :           0 :         if (enforced.length == 0) return _extraOptions;
    4484                 :             : 
    4485                 :             :         // No caller options, return enforced
    4486                 :           0 :         if (_extraOptions.length == 0) return enforced;
    4487                 :             : 
    4488                 :             :         // @dev If caller provided _extraOptions, must be type 3 as its the ONLY type that can be combined.
    4489            [ # ]:           0 :         if (_extraOptions.length >= 2) {
    4490                 :           0 :             _assertOptionsType3(_extraOptions);
    4491                 :             :             // @dev Remove the first 2 bytes containing the type from the _extraOptions and combine with enforced.
    4492                 :           0 :             return bytes.concat(enforced, _extraOptions[2:]);
    4493                 :             :         }
    4494                 :             : 
    4495                 :             :         // No valid set of options was found.
    4496                 :           0 :         revert InvalidOptions(_extraOptions);
    4497                 :             :     }
    4498                 :             : 
    4499                 :             :     /**
    4500                 :             :      * @dev Internal function to assert that options are of type 3.
    4501                 :             :      * @param _options The options to be checked.
    4502                 :             :      */
    4503                 :           0 :     function _assertOptionsType3(bytes memory _options) internal pure virtual {
    4504                 :           0 :         uint16 optionsType;
    4505                 :             :         assembly {
    4506                 :           0 :             optionsType := mload(add(_options, 2))
    4507                 :             :         }
    4508            [ # ]:           0 :         if (optionsType != OPTION_TYPE_3) revert InvalidOptions(_options);
    4509                 :             :     }
    4510                 :             : }
    4511                 :             : 
    4512                 :             : // contracts/ArtTokenCore.sol
    4513                 :             : 
    4514                 :             : /// @title ArtTokenCore - Core logic for ART token vesting and claims
    4515                 :             : /// @notice Manages token generation events (TGE), vesting schedules, and claims
    4516                 :             : /// @dev Uses Merkle proofs for claim verification and fixed-point math for calculations
    4517                 :             : abstract contract ArtTokenCore is IArtTokenCore {
    4518                 :             :     /* ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ CONSTANTS ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ */
    4519                 :             : 
    4520                 :             :     /// @notice Number of decimal places for the token
    4521                 :             :     uint8 public constant DECIMALS = 18;
    4522                 :             : 
    4523                 :             :     /// @notice Duration of the Token Generation Event (TGE)
    4524                 :             :     uint256 public constant TGE_DURATION = 7 days;
    4525                 :             : 
    4526                 :             :     /// @notice Duration of the vesting period after TGE
    4527                 :             :     uint256 public constant VESTING_DURATION = 180 days;
    4528                 :             : 
    4529                 :             :     /// @notice Maximum supply of ART tokens
    4530                 :             :     uint256 public constant MAX_SUPPLY = 1_000_000_000 * 10 ** DECIMALS;
    4531                 :             : 
    4532                 :             :     /* ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ STORAGE ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ */
    4533                 :             : 
    4534                 :             :     /// @notice Tracks the amount of tokens claimed by each user
    4535                 :             :     mapping(address => uint256) internal claimedAmount;
    4536                 :             : 
    4537                 :             :     /// @notice Stores claim details for each user
    4538                 :             :     mapping(address => Claim) internal claims;
    4539                 :             : 
    4540                 :             :     /// @notice Merkle root used for claim verification

    4565                 :           0 :     function getClaimableSupply() public view returns (uint256) {
    4566                 :           0 :         return claimableSupply;

    4568                 :             : 
    4569                 :             :     /// @notice Retrieves claim details for a specific address

    4571                 :             :     /// @return Claim struct containing claim details
    4572                 :           0 :     function claimDetailsByAccount(address account) external view returns (Claim memory) {
    4573                 :           0 :         return claims[account];
    4574                 :             :     }
    4575                 :             : 
    4576                 :             :     /// @notice Checks whether the TGE is currently active
    4577                 :             :     /// @return bool True if TGE is active, false otherwise
    4578                 :          11 :     function isTGEActive() public view returns (bool) {
    4579                 :          11 :         return tgeEnabledAt > 0 && block.timestamp >= tgeEnabledAt && block.timestamp <= tgeEnabledAt + TGE_DURATION;
    4580                 :             :     }
    4581                 :             : 
    4582                 :             :     /// @notice Returns the start and end timestamps for TGE and vesting periods
    4583                 :             :     /// @return tgeStart Start time of TGE
    4584                 :             :     /// @return tgeEnd End time of TGE
    4585                 :             :     /// @return vestingEnd End time of the vesting period
    4586                 :           0 :     function claimingPeriods() public view returns (uint256 tgeStart, uint256 tgeEnd, uint256 vestingEnd) {
    4587                 :           0 :         tgeStart = tgeEnabledAt;
    4588                 :           0 :         tgeEnd = tgeStart + TGE_DURATION;
    4589                 :           0 :         vestingEnd = tgeEnd + VESTING_DURATION;
    4590                 :             :     }
    4591                 :             : 
    4592                 :             :     /// @notice Calculates the daily release amount during vesting
    4593                 :             :     /// @param _allocatedAmount Total allocated tokens for the user
    4594                 :             :     /// @param _claimed Amount already claimed by the user
    4595                 :             :     /// @return uint256 Amount that can be claimed per day
    4596                 :           0 :     function calculateDailyRelease(uint256 _allocatedAmount, uint256 _claimed) public pure returns (uint256) {
    4597                 :           0 :         uint256 remaining = _allocatedAmount - _claimed;
    4598                 :           0 :         uint256 vestingCliff = 180; // days
    4599                 :           0 :         return FixedPointMathLib.mulDivDown(remaining, 1e18, uint256(vestingCliff) * 1e18);
    4600                 :             :     }
    4601                 :             : 
    4602                 :             :     /* ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ HELPER FUNCTIONS ▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀ */
    4603                 :             : 
    4604                 :             :     /// @notice Verifies a Merkle proof for a claim
    4605                 :             :     /// @param claimer Address of the claimant
    4606                 :             :     /// @param allocatedAmount Amount allocated to the claimer
    4607                 :             :     /// @param merkleProof Proof verifying the claim
    4608                 :           0 :     function verifyMerkleProof(address claimer, uint256 allocatedAmount, bytes32[] calldata merkleProof) internal view {
    4609                 :           0 :         bytes32 leaf = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(claimer, allocatedAmount));
    4610         [ #  # ]:           0 :         require(MerkleProof.verify(merkleProof, merkleRoot, leaf), "Invalid merkle proof");
    4611                 :             :     }
    4612                 :             : 
    4613                 :             :     /// @notice Calculates the claimable amount based on vesting schedules
    4614                 :             :     /// @param claimer Address of the claimant
    4615                 :             :     /// @param allocatedAmount Total allocated tokens for the user
    4616                 :             :     /// @return releaseAmount Amount that can be claimed in the current cycle
    4617                 :           0 :     function calculateReleaseAmount(address claimer, uint256 allocatedAmount) internal returns (uint256 releaseAmount) {
    4618                 :           0 :         Claim storage userClaim = claims[claimer];
    4619                 :             : 
    4620                 :             :         // After vesting period, claim all remaining tokens
    4621                 :           0 :         (,, uint256 vestingEnd) = claimingPeriods();
    4622            [ # ]:           0 :         if (block.timestamp >= vestingEnd) {
    4623                 :           0 :             return allocatedAmount - userClaim.claimed;
    4624                 :             :         }
    4625                 :             : 
    4626                 :             :         // During TGE period
    4627            [ # ]:           0 :         if (isTGEActive()) {
    4628         [ #  # ]:           0 :             require(!userClaim.claimedAtTGE, "Already claimed TGE amount");
    4629                 :           0 :             uint256 tgeAmount = FixedPointMathLib.mulWadUp(allocatedAmount, formatToE18(tgeClaimPercentage));
    4630                 :           0 :             userClaim.dailyRelease = calculateDailyRelease(allocatedAmount, tgeAmount);
    4631                 :           0 :             return tgeAmount;
    4632                 :             :         }
    4633                 :             : 
    4634                 :             :         // During vesting period
    4635         [ #  # ]:           0 :         require(userClaim.lastClaimed + 1 days <= block.timestamp, "Claim only once per day");
    4636         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (userClaim.dailyRelease == 0) {
    4637                 :           0 :             userClaim.dailyRelease = calculateDailyRelease(allocatedAmount, userClaim.claimed);
    4638                 :           0 :             return userClaim.dailyRelease;
    4639                 :             :         } else {
    4640                 :           0 :             return userClaim.dailyRelease;
    4641                 :             :         }
    4642                 :             :     }
    4643                 :             : 
    4644                 :             :     /// @notice Formats a percentage value to a fixed-point 18-decimal representation
    4645                 :             :     /// @param percentage The percentage value (1-100)
    4646                 :             :     /// @return uint256 The percentage scaled to 18 decimals
    4647                 :           0 :     function formatToE18(uint256 percentage) internal pure returns (uint256) {
    4648         [ #  # ]:           0 :         require(percentage >= 1 && percentage <= 100, "Value must be between 1 and 100");
    4649                 :           0 :         return (percentage * 1e18) / 100;
    4650                 :             :     }
    4651                 :             : }
    4652                 :             : 
    4653                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol
    4654                 :             : 
    4655                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.2.0) (token/ERC20/ERC20.sol)
    4656                 :             : 
    4657                 :             : /**
    4658                 :             :  * @dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface.
    4659                 :             :  *
    4660                 :             :  * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means
    4661                 :             :  * that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using {_mint}.
    4662                 :             :  *
    4663                 :             :  * TIP: For a detailed writeup see our guide
    4664                 :             :  * https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/how-to-implement-erc20-supply-mechanisms/226[How
    4665                 :             :  * to implement supply mechanisms].
    4666                 :             :  *
    4667                 :             :  * The default value of {decimals} is 18. To change this, you should override
    4668                 :             :  * this function so it returns a different value.
    4669                 :             :  *
    4670                 :             :  * We have followed general OpenZeppelin Contracts guidelines: functions revert
    4671                 :             :  * instead returning `false` on failure. This behavior is nonetheless
    4672                 :             :  * conventional and does not conflict with the expectations of ERC-20
    4673                 :             :  * applications.
    4674                 :             :  */
    4675                 :             : abstract contract ERC20 is Context, IERC20, IERC20Metadata, IERC20Errors {
    4676                 :             :     mapping(address account => uint256) private _balances;
    4677                 :             : 
    4678                 :             :     mapping(address account => mapping(address spender => uint256)) private _allowances;
    4679                 :             : 
    4680                 :             :     uint256 private _totalSupply;
    4681                 :             : 
    4682                 :             :     string private _name;
    4683                 :             :     string private _symbol;
    4684                 :             : 
    4685                 :             :     /**
    4686                 :             :      * @dev Sets the values for {name} and {symbol}.
    4687                 :             :      *
    4688                 :             :      * All two of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during
    4689                 :             :      * construction.
    4690                 :             :      */
    4691                 :          58 :     constructor(string memory name_, string memory symbol_) {
    4692                 :          58 :         _name = name_;
    4693                 :          58 :         _symbol = symbol_;
    4694                 :             :     }
    4695                 :             : 
    4696                 :             :     /**
    4697                 :             :      * @dev Returns the name of the token.
    4698                 :             :      */
    4699                 :           0 :     function name() public view virtual returns (string memory) {
    4700                 :           0 :         return _name;
    4701                 :             :     }
    4702                 :             : 
    4703                 :             :     /**
    4704                 :             :      * @dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
    4705                 :             :      * name.
    4706                 :             :      */
    4707                 :           0 :     function symbol() public view virtual returns (string memory) {
    4708                 :           0 :         return _symbol;
    4709                 :             :     }
    4710                 :             : 
    4711                 :             :     /**
    4712                 :             :      * @dev Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.
    4713                 :             :      * For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should
    4714                 :             :      * be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).
    4715                 :             :      *
    4716                 :             :      * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between
    4717                 :             :      * Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless
    4718                 :             :      * it's overridden.
    4719                 :             :      *
    4720                 :             :      * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in
    4721                 :             :      * no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including
    4722                 :             :      * {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.
    4723                 :             :      */
    4724                 :           0 :     function decimals() public view virtual returns (uint8) {
    4725                 :           0 :         return 18;
    4726                 :             :     }
    4727                 :             : 
    4728                 :             :     /**
    4729                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-totalSupply}.
    4730                 :             :      */
    4731                 :         169 :     function totalSupply() public view virtual returns (uint256) {
    4732                 :         169 :         return _totalSupply;
    4733                 :             :     }
    4734                 :             : 
    4735                 :             :     /**
    4736                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-balanceOf}.
    4737                 :             :      */
    4738                 :          14 :     function balanceOf(address account) public view virtual returns (uint256) {
    4739                 :          14 :         return _balances[account];
    4740                 :             :     }
    4741                 :             : 
    4742                 :             :     /**
    4743                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-transfer}.
    4744                 :             :      *
    4745                 :             :      * Requirements:
    4746                 :             :      *
    4747                 :             :      * - `to` cannot be the zero address.
    4748                 :             :      * - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.
    4749                 :             :      */
    4750                 :           4 :     function transfer(address to, uint256 value) public virtual returns (bool) {
    4751                 :           4 :         address owner = _msgSender();
    4752                 :           4 :         _transfer(owner, to, value);
    4753                 :           4 :         return true;
    4754                 :             :     }
    4755                 :             : 
    4756                 :             :     /**
    4757                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-allowance}.
    4758                 :             :      */
    4759                 :          23 :     function allowance(address owner, address spender) public view virtual returns (uint256) {
    4760                 :          23 :         return _allowances[owner][spender];
    4761                 :             :     }
    4762                 :             : 
    4763                 :             :     /**
    4764                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-approve}.
    4765                 :             :      *
    4766                 :             :      * NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on
    4767                 :             :      * `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval.
    4768                 :             :      *
    4769                 :             :      * Requirements:
    4770                 :             :      *
    4771                 :             :      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
    4772                 :             :      */
    4773                 :          27 :     function approve(address spender, uint256 value) public virtual returns (bool) {
    4774                 :          27 :         address owner = _msgSender();
    4775                 :          27 :         _approve(owner, spender, value);
    4776                 :          27 :         return true;
    4777                 :             :     }
    4778                 :             : 
    4779                 :             :     /**
    4780                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC20-transferFrom}.
    4781                 :             :      *
    4782                 :             :      * Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not
    4783                 :             :      * required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve].
    4784                 :             :      *
    4785                 :             :      * NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance
    4786                 :             :      * is the maximum `uint256`.
    4787                 :             :      *
    4788                 :             :      * Requirements:
    4789                 :             :      *
    4790                 :             :      * - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address.
    4791                 :             :      * - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`.
    4792                 :             :      * - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least
    4793                 :             :      * `value`.
    4794                 :             :      */
    4795                 :          10 :     function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 value) public virtual returns (bool) {
    4796                 :          10 :         address spender = _msgSender();
    4797                 :          10 :         _spendAllowance(from, spender, value);
    4798                 :          10 :         _transfer(from, to, value);
    4799                 :          10 :         return true;
    4800                 :             :     }
    4801                 :             : 
    4802                 :             :     /**
    4803                 :             :      * @dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to`.
    4804                 :             :      *
    4805                 :             :      * This internal function is equivalent to {transfer}, and can be used to
    4806                 :             :      * e.g. implement automatic token fees, slashing mechanisms, etc.
    4807                 :             :      *
    4808                 :             :      * Emits a {Transfer} event.
    4809                 :             :      *
    4810                 :             :      * NOTE: This function is not virtual, {_update} should be overridden instead.
    4811                 :             :      */
    4812                 :          14 :     function _transfer(address from, address to, uint256 value) internal {
    4813            [ # ]:          14 :         if (from == address(0)) {
    4814                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidSender(address(0));
    4815                 :             :         }
    4816            [ # ]:          14 :         if (to == address(0)) {
    4817                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidReceiver(address(0));
    4818                 :             :         }
    4819                 :          14 :         _update(from, to, value);
    4820                 :             :     }
    4821                 :             : 
    4822                 :             :     /**
    4823                 :             :      * @dev Transfers a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to`, or alternatively mints (or burns) if `from`
    4824                 :             :      * (or `to`) is the zero address. All customizations to transfers, mints, and burns should be done by overriding
    4825                 :             :      * this function.
    4826                 :             :      *
    4827                 :             :      * Emits a {Transfer} event.
    4828                 :             :      */
    4829                 :         113 :     function _update(address from, address to, uint256 value) internal virtual {
    4830         [ +  # ]:         113 :         if (from == address(0)) {
    4831                 :             :             // Overflow check required: The rest of the code assumes that totalSupply never overflows
    4832                 :          99 :             _totalSupply += value;
    4833                 :             :         } else {
    4834                 :          14 :             uint256 fromBalance = _balances[from];
    4835            [ # ]:          14 :             if (fromBalance < value) {
    4836                 :           0 :                 revert ERC20InsufficientBalance(from, fromBalance, value);
    4837                 :             :             }
    4838                 :             :             unchecked {
    4839                 :             :                 // Overflow not possible: value <= fromBalance <= totalSupply.
    4840                 :          14 :                 _balances[from] = fromBalance - value;
    4841                 :             :             }
    4842                 :             :         }
    4843                 :             : 
    4844         [ #  + ]:          99 :         if (to == address(0)) {
    4845                 :             :             unchecked {
    4846                 :             :                 // Overflow not possible: value <= totalSupply or value <= fromBalance <= totalSupply.
    4847                 :           0 :                 _totalSupply -= value;
    4848                 :             :             }
    4849                 :             :         } else {
    4850                 :             :             unchecked {
    4851                 :             :                 // Overflow not possible: balance + value is at most totalSupply, which we know fits into a uint256.
    4852                 :         113 :                 _balances[to] += value;
    4853                 :             :             }
    4854                 :             :         }
    4855                 :             : 
    4856                 :          99 :         emit Transfer(from, to, value);
    4857                 :             :     }
    4858                 :             : 
    4859                 :             :     /**
    4860                 :             :      * @dev Creates a `value` amount of tokens and assigns them to `account`, by transferring it from address(0).
    4861                 :             :      * Relies on the `_update` mechanism
    4862                 :             :      *
    4863                 :             :      * Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.
    4864                 :             :      *
    4865                 :             :      * NOTE: This function is not virtual, {_update} should be overridden instead.
    4866                 :             :      */
    4867                 :          99 :     function _mint(address account, uint256 value) internal {
    4868            [ # ]:          99 :         if (account == address(0)) {
    4869                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidReceiver(address(0));
    4870                 :             :         }
    4871                 :          99 :         _update(address(0), account, value);
    4872                 :             :     }
    4873                 :             : 
    4874                 :             :     /**
    4875                 :             :      * @dev Destroys a `value` amount of tokens from `account`, lowering the total supply.
    4876                 :             :      * Relies on the `_update` mechanism.
    4877                 :             :      *
    4878                 :             :      * Emits a {Transfer} event with `to` set to the zero address.
    4879                 :             :      *
    4880                 :             :      * NOTE: This function is not virtual, {_update} should be overridden instead.
    4881                 :             :      */
    4882                 :           0 :     function _burn(address account, uint256 value) internal {
    4883            [ # ]:           0 :         if (account == address(0)) {
    4884                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidSender(address(0));
    4885                 :             :         }
    4886                 :           0 :         _update(account, address(0), value);
    4887                 :             :     }
    4888                 :             : 
    4889                 :             :     /**
    4890                 :             :      * @dev Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over the `owner` s tokens.
    4891                 :             :      *
    4892                 :             :      * This internal function is equivalent to `approve`, and can be used to
    4893                 :             :      * e.g. set automatic allowances for certain subsystems, etc.
    4894                 :             :      *
    4895                 :             :      * Emits an {Approval} event.
    4896                 :             :      *
    4897                 :             :      * Requirements:
    4898                 :             :      *
    4899                 :             :      * - `owner` cannot be the zero address.
    4900                 :             :      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
    4901                 :             :      *
    4902                 :             :      * Overrides to this logic should be done to the variant with an additional `bool emitEvent` argument.
    4903                 :             :      */
    4904                 :          27 :     function _approve(address owner, address spender, uint256 value) internal {
    4905                 :          27 :         _approve(owner, spender, value, true);
    4906                 :             :     }
    4907                 :             : 
    4908                 :             :     /**
    4909                 :             :      * @dev Variant of {_approve} with an optional flag to enable or disable the {Approval} event.
    4910                 :             :      *
    4911                 :             :      * By default (when calling {_approve}) the flag is set to true. On the other hand, approval changes made by
    4912                 :             :      * `_spendAllowance` during the `transferFrom` operation set the flag to false. This saves gas by not emitting any
    4913                 :             :      * `Approval` event during `transferFrom` operations.
    4914                 :             :      *
    4915                 :             :      * Anyone who wishes to continue emitting `Approval` events on the`transferFrom` operation can force the flag to
    4916                 :             :      * true using the following override:
    4917                 :             :      *
    4918                 :             :      * ```solidity
    4919                 :             :      * function _approve(address owner, address spender, uint256 value, bool) internal virtual override {
    4920                 :             :      *     super._approve(owner, spender, value, true);
    4921                 :             :      * }
    4922                 :             :      * ```
    4923                 :             :      *
    4924                 :             :      * Requirements are the same as {_approve}.
    4925                 :             :      */
    4926                 :          37 :     function _approve(address owner, address spender, uint256 value, bool emitEvent) internal virtual {
    4927            [ # ]:          37 :         if (owner == address(0)) {
    4928                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidApprover(address(0));
    4929                 :             :         }
    4930            [ # ]:          37 :         if (spender == address(0)) {
    4931                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidSpender(address(0));
    4932                 :             :         }
    4933                 :          37 :         _allowances[owner][spender] = value;
    4934            [ + ]:          27 :         if (emitEvent) {
    4935                 :          27 :             emit Approval(owner, spender, value);
    4936                 :             :         }
    4937                 :             :     }
    4938                 :             : 
    4939                 :             :     /**
    4940                 :             :      * @dev Updates `owner` s allowance for `spender` based on spent `value`.
    4941                 :             :      *
    4942                 :             :      * Does not update the allowance value in case of infinite allowance.
    4943                 :             :      * Revert if not enough allowance is available.
    4944                 :             :      *
    4945                 :             :      * Does not emit an {Approval} event.
    4946                 :             :      */
    4947                 :          10 :     function _spendAllowance(address owner, address spender, uint256 value) internal virtual {
    4948                 :          10 :         uint256 currentAllowance = allowance(owner, spender);
    4949            [ + ]:          10 :         if (currentAllowance < type(uint256).max) {
    4950            [ # ]:          10 :             if (currentAllowance < value) {
    4951                 :           0 :                 revert ERC20InsufficientAllowance(spender, currentAllowance, value);
    4952                 :             :             }
    4953                 :             :             unchecked {
    4954                 :          10 :                 _approve(owner, spender, currentAllowance - value, false);
    4955                 :             :             }
    4956                 :             :         }
    4957                 :             :     }
    4958                 :             : }
    4959                 :             : 
    4960                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC1363.sol
    4961                 :             : 
    4962                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.1.0) (interfaces/IERC1363.sol)
    4963                 :             : 
    4964                 :             : /**
    4965                 :             :  * @title IERC1363
    4966                 :             :  * @dev Interface of the ERC-1363 standard as defined in the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1363[ERC-1363].
    4967                 :             :  *
    4968                 :             :  * Defines an extension interface for ERC-20 tokens that supports executing code on a recipient contract
    4969                 :             :  * after `transfer` or `transferFrom`, or code on a spender contract after `approve`, in a single transaction.
    4970                 :             :  */
    4971                 :             : interface IERC1363 is IERC20, IERC165 {
    4972                 :             :     /*
    4973                 :             :      * Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0xb0202a11.
    4974                 :             :      * 0xb0202a11 ===
    4975                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('transferAndCall(address,uint256)')) ^
    4976                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('transferAndCall(address,uint256,bytes)')) ^
    4977                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('transferFromAndCall(address,address,uint256)')) ^
    4978                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('transferFromAndCall(address,address,uint256,bytes)')) ^
    4979                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('approveAndCall(address,uint256)')) ^
    4980                 :             :      *   bytes4(keccak256('approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes)'))
    4981                 :             :      */
    4982                 :             : 
    4983                 :             :     /**
    4984                 :             :      * @dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from the caller's account to `to`
    4985                 :             :      * and then calls {IERC1363Receiver-onTransferReceived} on `to`.
    4986                 :             :      * @param to The address which you want to transfer to.
    4987                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be transferred.
    4988                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    4989                 :             :      */
    4990                 :             :     function transferAndCall(address to, uint256 value) external returns (bool);
    4991                 :             : 
    4992                 :             :     /**
    4993                 :             :      * @dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from the caller's account to `to`
    4994                 :             :      * and then calls {IERC1363Receiver-onTransferReceived} on `to`.
    4995                 :             :      * @param to The address which you want to transfer to.
    4996                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be transferred.
    4997                 :             :      * @param data Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `to`.
    4998                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    4999                 :             :      */
    5000                 :             :     function transferAndCall(address to, uint256 value, bytes calldata data) external returns (bool);
    5001                 :             : 
    5002                 :             :     /**
    5003                 :             :      * @dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism
    5004                 :             :      * and then calls {IERC1363Receiver-onTransferReceived} on `to`.
    5005                 :             :      * @param from The address which you want to send tokens from.
    5006                 :             :      * @param to The address which you want to transfer to.
    5007                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be transferred.
    5008                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    5009                 :             :      */
    5010                 :             :     function transferFromAndCall(address from, address to, uint256 value) external returns (bool);
    5011                 :             : 
    5012                 :             :     /**
    5013                 :             :      * @dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism
    5014                 :             :      * and then calls {IERC1363Receiver-onTransferReceived} on `to`.
    5015                 :             :      * @param from The address which you want to send tokens from.
    5016                 :             :      * @param to The address which you want to transfer to.
    5017                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be transferred.
    5018                 :             :      * @param data Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `to`.
    5019                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    5020                 :             :      */
    5021                 :             :     function transferFromAndCall(address from, address to, uint256 value, bytes calldata data) external returns (bool);
    5022                 :             : 
    5023                 :             :     /**
    5024                 :             :      * @dev Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the
    5025                 :             :      * caller's tokens and then calls {IERC1363Spender-onApprovalReceived} on `spender`.
    5026                 :             :      * @param spender The address which will spend the funds.
    5027                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be spent.
    5028                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    5029                 :             :      */
    5030                 :             :     function approveAndCall(address spender, uint256 value) external returns (bool);
    5031                 :             : 
    5032                 :             :     /**
    5033                 :             :      * @dev Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the
    5034                 :             :      * caller's tokens and then calls {IERC1363Spender-onApprovalReceived} on `spender`.
    5035                 :             :      * @param spender The address which will spend the funds.
    5036                 :             :      * @param value The amount of tokens to be spent.
    5037                 :             :      * @param data Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `spender`.
    5038                 :             :      * @return A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded unless throwing.
    5039                 :             :      */
    5040                 :             :     function approveAndCall(address spender, uint256 value, bytes calldata data) external returns (bool);
    5041                 :             : }
    5042                 :             : 
    5043                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/lz-evm-protocol-v2/contracts/interfaces/ILayerZeroEndpointV2.sol
    5044                 :             : 
    5045                 :             : struct MessagingParams {
    5046                 :             :     uint32 dstEid;
    5047                 :             :     bytes32 receiver;
    5048                 :             :     bytes message;
    5049                 :             :     bytes options;
    5050                 :             :     bool payInLzToken;
    5051                 :             : }
    5052                 :             : 
    5053                 :             : struct MessagingReceipt {
    5054                 :             :     bytes32 guid;
    5055                 :             :     uint64 nonce;
    5056                 :             :     MessagingFee fee;
    5057                 :             : }
    5058                 :             : 
    5059                 :             : struct MessagingFee {
    5060                 :             :     uint256 nativeFee;
    5061                 :             :     uint256 lzTokenFee;
    5062                 :             : }
    5063                 :             : 
    5064                 :             : struct Origin {
    5065                 :             :     uint32 srcEid;
    5066                 :             :     bytes32 sender;
    5067                 :             :     uint64 nonce;
    5068                 :             : }
    5069                 :             :

    5072                 :             :

    5097                 :             :         address _refundAddress
    5098                 :             :     ) external payable returns (MessagingReceipt memory);

    5105                 :             :

    5116                 :             :

    5126                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol
    5127                 :             : 
    5128                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.2.0) (utils/Strings.sol)
    5129                 :             : 
    5130                 :             : /**
    5131                 :             :  * @dev String operations.
    5132                 :             :  */
    5133                 :             : library Strings {
    5134                 :             :     using SafeCast for *;
    5135                 :             : 
    5136                 :             :     bytes16 private constant HEX_DIGITS = "0123456789abcdef";
    5137                 :             :     uint8 private constant ADDRESS_LENGTH = 20;
    5138                 :             : 
    5139                 :             :     /**
    5140                 :             :      * @dev The `value` string doesn't fit in the specified `length`.
    5141                 :             :      */
    5142                 :             :     error StringsInsufficientHexLength(uint256 value, uint256 length);
    5143                 :             : 
    5144                 :             :     /**
    5145                 :             :      * @dev The string being parsed contains characters that are not in scope of the given base.
    5146                 :             :      */
    5147                 :             :     error StringsInvalidChar();
    5148                 :             : 
    5149                 :             :     /**
    5150                 :             :      * @dev The string being parsed is not a properly formatted address.
    5151                 :             :      */
    5152                 :             :     error StringsInvalidAddressFormat();
    5153                 :             : 
    5154                 :             :     /**
    5155                 :             :      * @dev Converts a `uint256` to its ASCII `string` decimal representation.
    5156                 :             :      */
    5157                 :           0 :     function toString(uint256 value) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5158                 :             :         unchecked {
    5159                 :           0 :             uint256 length = Math.log10(value) + 1;
    5160                 :           0 :             string memory buffer = new string(length);
    5161                 :           0 :             uint256 ptr;
    5162                 :             :             assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5163                 :           0 :                 ptr := add(buffer, add(32, length))
    5164                 :             :             }
    5165                 :             :             while (true) {
    5166                 :           0 :                 ptr--;
    5167                 :             :                 assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5168                 :           0 :                     mstore8(ptr, byte(mod(value, 10), HEX_DIGITS))
    5169                 :             :                 }
    5170                 :           0 :                 value /= 10;
    5171                 :           0 :                 if (value == 0) break;
    5172                 :             :             }
    5173                 :           0 :             return buffer;
    5174                 :             :         }
    5175                 :             :     }
    5176                 :             : 
    5177                 :             :     /**
    5178                 :             :      * @dev Converts a `int256` to its ASCII `string` decimal representation.
    5179                 :             :      */
    5180                 :           0 :     function toStringSigned(int256 value) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5181                 :           0 :         return string.concat(value < 0 ? "-" : "", toString(SignedMath.abs(value)));
    5182                 :             :     }
    5183                 :             : 
    5184                 :             :     /**
    5185                 :             :      * @dev Converts a `uint256` to its ASCII `string` hexadecimal representation.
    5186                 :             :      */
    5187                 :           0 :     function toHexString(uint256 value) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5188                 :             :         unchecked {
    5189                 :           0 :             return toHexString(value, Math.log256(value) + 1);
    5190                 :             :         }
    5191                 :             :     }
    5192                 :             : 
    5193                 :             :     /**
    5194                 :             :      * @dev Converts a `uint256` to its ASCII `string` hexadecimal representation with fixed length.
    5195                 :             :      */
    5196                 :           0 :     function toHexString(uint256 value, uint256 length) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5197                 :           0 :         uint256 localValue = value;
    5198                 :           0 :         bytes memory buffer = new bytes(2 * length + 2);
    5199                 :           0 :         buffer[0] = "0";
    5200                 :           0 :         buffer[1] = "x";
    5201                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = 2 * length + 1; i > 1; --i) {
    5202                 :           0 :             buffer[i] = HEX_DIGITS[localValue & 0xf];
    5203                 :           0 :             localValue >>= 4;
    5204                 :             :         }
    5205            [ # ]:           0 :         if (localValue != 0) {
    5206                 :           0 :             revert StringsInsufficientHexLength(value, length);
    5207                 :             :         }
    5208                 :           0 :         return string(buffer);
    5209                 :             :     }
    5210                 :             : 
    5211                 :             :     /**
    5212                 :             :      * @dev Converts an `address` with fixed length of 20 bytes to its not checksummed ASCII `string` hexadecimal
    5213                 :             :      * representation.
    5214                 :             :      */
    5215                 :           0 :     function toHexString(address addr) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5216                 :           0 :         return toHexString(uint256(uint160(addr)), ADDRESS_LENGTH);
    5217                 :             :     }
    5218                 :             : 
    5219                 :             :     /**
    5220                 :             :      * @dev Converts an `address` with fixed length of 20 bytes to its checksummed ASCII `string` hexadecimal
    5221                 :             :      * representation, according to EIP-55.
    5222                 :             :      */
    5223                 :           0 :     function toChecksumHexString(address addr) internal pure returns (string memory) {
    5224                 :           0 :         bytes memory buffer = bytes(toHexString(addr));
    5225                 :             : 
    5226                 :             :         // hash the hex part of buffer (skip length + 2 bytes, length 40)
    5227                 :           0 :         uint256 hashValue;
    5228                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5229                 :           0 :             hashValue := shr(96, keccak256(add(buffer, 0x22), 40))
    5230                 :             :         }
    5231                 :             : 
    5232                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = 41; i > 1; --i) {
    5233                 :             :             // possible values for buffer[i] are 48 (0) to 57 (9) and 97 (a) to 102 (f)
    5234            [ # ]:           0 :             if (hashValue & 0xf > 7 && uint8(buffer[i]) > 96) {
    5235                 :             :                 // case shift by xoring with 0x20
    5236                 :           0 :                 buffer[i] ^= 0x20;
    5237                 :             :             }
    5238                 :           0 :             hashValue >>= 4;
    5239                 :             :         }
    5240                 :           0 :         return string(buffer);
    5241                 :             :     }
    5242                 :             : 
    5243                 :             :     /**
    5244                 :             :      * @dev Returns true if the two strings are equal.
    5245                 :             :      */
    5246                 :           0 :     function equal(string memory a, string memory b) internal pure returns (bool) {
    5247                 :           0 :         return bytes(a).length == bytes(b).length && keccak256(bytes(a)) == keccak256(bytes(b));
    5248                 :             :     }
    5249                 :             :

    5288                 :             :      * NOTE: This function will revert if the result does not fit in a `uint256`.

    5297                 :             :     }

    5300                 :             :      * @dev Implementation of {tryParseUint} that does not check bounds. Caller should make sure that
    5301                 :             :      * `begin <= end <= input.length`. Other inputs would result in undefined behavior.
    5302                 :             :      */

    5304                 :             :         string memory input,
    5305                 :             :         uint256 begin,
    5306                 :             :         uint256 end
    5307                 :             :     ) private pure returns (bool success, uint256 value) {
    5308                 :           0 :         bytes memory buffer = bytes(input);
    5309                 :             : 
    5310                 :           0 :         uint256 result = 0;

    5314                 :           0 :             result *= 10;
    5315                 :           0 :             result += chr;
    5316                 :             :         }
    5317                 :           0 :         return (true, result);

    5355                 :             :     uint256 private constant ABS_MIN_INT256 = 2 ** 255;
    5356                 :             : 
    5357                 :             :     /**
    5358                 :             :      * @dev Variant of {parseInt-string-uint256-uint256} that returns false if the parsing fails because of an invalid

    5360                 :             :      *

    5364                 :             :         string memory input,

    5368                 :           0 :         if (end > bytes(input).length || begin > end) return (false, 0);
    5369                 :           0 :         return _tryParseIntUncheckedBounds(input, begin, end);
    5370                 :             :     }
    5371                 :             : 
    5372                 :             :     /**
    5373                 :             :      * @dev Implementation of {tryParseInt} that does not check bounds. Caller should make sure that
    5374                 :             :      * `begin <= end <= input.length`. Other inputs would result in undefined behavior.
    5375                 :             :      */
    5376                 :           0 :     function _tryParseIntUncheckedBounds(
    5377                 :             :         string memory input,
    5378                 :             :         uint256 begin,
    5379                 :             :         uint256 end
    5380                 :             :     ) private pure returns (bool success, int256 value) {
    5381                 :           0 :         bytes memory buffer = bytes(input);
    5382                 :             : 
    5383                 :             :         // Check presence of a negative sign.
    5384                 :           0 :         bytes1 sign = begin == end ? bytes1(0) : bytes1(_unsafeReadBytesOffset(buffer, begin)); // don't do out-of-bound (possibly unsafe) read if sub-string is empty
    5385                 :           0 :         bool positiveSign = sign == bytes1("+");
    5386                 :           0 :         bool negativeSign = sign == bytes1("-");
    5387                 :           0 :         uint256 offset = (positiveSign || negativeSign).toUint();
    5388                 :             : 
    5389                 :           0 :         (bool absSuccess, uint256 absValue) = tryParseUint(input, begin + offset, end);
    5390                 :             : 
    5391         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (absSuccess && absValue < ABS_MIN_INT256) {
    5392                 :           0 :             return (true, negativeSign ? -int256(absValue) : int256(absValue));
    5393         [ #  # ]:           0 :         } else if (absSuccess && negativeSign && absValue == ABS_MIN_INT256) {
    5394                 :           0 :             return (true, type(int256).min);
    5395                 :           0 :         } else return (false, 0);
    5396                 :             :     }
    5397                 :             :

    5446                 :             : 
    5447                 :             :     /**
    5448                 :             :      * @dev Implementation of {tryParseHexUint} that does not check bounds. Caller should make sure that
    5449                 :             :      * `begin <= end <= input.length`. Other inputs would result in undefined behavior.
    5450                 :             :      */
    5451                 :           0 :     function _tryParseHexUintUncheckedBounds(
    5452                 :             :         string memory input,
    5453                 :             :         uint256 begin,
    5454                 :             :         uint256 end
    5455                 :             :     ) private pure returns (bool success, uint256 value) {
    5456                 :           0 :         bytes memory buffer = bytes(input);
    5457                 :             : 
    5458                 :             :         // skip 0x prefix if present
    5459                 :           0 :         bool hasPrefix = (end > begin + 1) && bytes2(_unsafeReadBytesOffset(buffer, begin)) == bytes2("0x"); // don't do out-of-bound (possibly unsafe) read if sub-string is empty
    5460                 :           0 :         uint256 offset = hasPrefix.toUint() * 2;
    5461                 :             : 
    5462                 :           0 :         uint256 result = 0;
    5463                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = begin + offset; i < end; ++i) {
    5464                 :           0 :             uint8 chr = _tryParseChr(bytes1(_unsafeReadBytesOffset(buffer, i)));
    5465                 :           0 :             if (chr > 15) return (false, 0);
    5466                 :           0 :             result *= 16;
    5467                 :             :             unchecked {
    5468                 :             :                 // Multiplying by 16 is equivalent to a shift of 4 bits (with additional overflow check).
    5469                 :             :                 // This guaratees that adding a value < 16 will not cause an overflow, hence the unchecked.
    5470                 :           0 :                 result += chr;
    5471                 :             :             }
    5472                 :             :         }
    5473                 :           0 :         return (true, result);
    5474                 :             :     }
    5475                 :             : 
    5476                 :             :     /**
    5477                 :             :      * @dev Parse a hexadecimal string (with or without "0x" prefix), and returns the value as an `address`.

    5503                 :           0 :     function tryParseAddress(string memory input) internal pure returns (bool success, address value) {

    5509                 :             :      * formatted address. See {parseAddress} requirements.
    5510                 :             :      */
    5511                 :           0 :     function tryParseAddress(
    5512                 :             :         string memory input,
    5513                 :             :         uint256 begin,
    5514                 :             :         uint256 end
    5515                 :             :     ) internal pure returns (bool success, address value) {
    5516                 :           0 :         if (end > bytes(input).length || begin > end) return (false, address(0));
    5517                 :             : 
    5518                 :           0 :         bool hasPrefix = (end > begin + 1) && bytes2(_unsafeReadBytesOffset(bytes(input), begin)) == bytes2("0x"); // don't do out-of-bound (possibly unsafe) read if sub-string is empty
    5519                 :           0 :         uint256 expectedLength = 40 + hasPrefix.toUint() * 2;
    5520                 :             : 
    5521                 :             :         // check that input is the correct length
    5522         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (end - begin == expectedLength) {
    5523                 :             :             // length guarantees that this does not overflow, and value is at most type(uint160).max
    5524                 :           0 :             (bool s, uint256 v) = _tryParseHexUintUncheckedBounds(input, begin, end);
    5525                 :           0 :             return (s, address(uint160(v)));
    5526                 :             :         } else {
    5527                 :           0 :             return (false, address(0));
    5528                 :             :         }
    5529                 :             :     }
    5530                 :             : 
    5531                 :           0 :     function _tryParseChr(bytes1 chr) private pure returns (uint8) {
    5532                 :           0 :         uint8 value = uint8(chr);
    5533                 :             : 
    5534                 :             :         // Try to parse `chr`:
    5535                 :             :         // - Case 1: [0-9]
    5536                 :             :         // - Case 2: [a-f]
    5537                 :             :         // - Case 3: [A-F]
    5538                 :             :         // - otherwise not supported
    5539                 :             :         unchecked {
    5540         [ #  # ]:           0 :             if (value > 47 && value < 58) value -= 48;
    5541         [ #  # ]:           0 :             else if (value > 96 && value < 103) value -= 87;
    5542         [ #  # ]:           0 :             else if (value > 64 && value < 71) value -= 55;
    5543                 :           0 :             else return type(uint8).max;
    5544                 :             :         }
    5545                 :             : 
    5546                 :           0 :         return value;
    5547                 :             :     }
    5548                 :             : 
    5549                 :             :     /**
    5550                 :             :      * @dev Reads a bytes32 from a bytes array without bounds checking.
    5551                 :             :      *
    5552                 :             :      * NOTE: making this function internal would mean it could be used with memory unsafe offset, and marking the
    5553                 :             :      * assembly block as such would prevent some optimizations.
    5554                 :             :      */
    5555                 :           0 :     function _unsafeReadBytesOffset(bytes memory buffer, uint256 offset) private pure returns (bytes32 value) {
    5556                 :             :         // This is not memory safe in the general case, but all calls to this private function are within bounds.
    5557                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5558                 :           0 :             value := mload(add(buffer, add(0x20, offset)))
    5559                 :             :         }
    5560                 :             :     }
    5561                 :             : }
    5562                 :             :

    5564                 :             : 
    5565                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Capped.sol)
    5566                 :             : 
    5567                 :             : /**
    5568                 :             :  * @dev Extension of {ERC20} that adds a cap to the supply of tokens.
    5569                 :             :  */
    5570                 :             : abstract contract ERC20Capped is ERC20 {
    5571                 :             :     uint256 private immutable _cap;
    5572                 :             : 
    5573                 :             :     /**
    5574                 :             :      * @dev Total supply cap has been exceeded.
    5575                 :             :      */
    5576                 :             :     error ERC20ExceededCap(uint256 increasedSupply, uint256 cap);
    5577                 :             : 
    5578                 :             :     /**
    5579                 :             :      * @dev The supplied cap is not a valid cap.
    5580                 :             :      */
    5581                 :             :     error ERC20InvalidCap(uint256 cap);
    5582                 :             : 
    5583                 :             :     /**
    5584                 :             :      * @dev Sets the value of the `cap`. This value is immutable, it can only be
    5585                 :             :      * set once during construction.
    5586                 :             :      */
    5587                 :          58 :     constructor(uint256 cap_) {
    5588            [ # ]:          58 :         if (cap_ == 0) {
    5589                 :           0 :             revert ERC20InvalidCap(0);
    5590                 :             :         }
    5591                 :          58 :         _cap = cap_;
    5592                 :             :     }
    5593                 :             : 
    5594                 :             :     /**
    5595                 :             :      * @dev Returns the cap on the token's total supply.
    5596                 :             :      */
    5597                 :           0 :     function cap() public view virtual returns (uint256) {
    5598                 :           0 :         return _cap;
    5599                 :             :     }
    5600                 :             : 
    5601                 :             :     /**
    5602                 :             :      * @dev See {ERC20-_update}.
    5603                 :             :      */
    5604                 :         113 :     function _update(address from, address to, uint256 value) internal virtual override {
    5605                 :         113 :         super._update(from, to, value);
    5606                 :             : 
    5607            [ + ]:         113 :         if (from == address(0)) {
    5608                 :          99 :             uint256 maxSupply = cap();
    5609                 :          99 :             uint256 supply = totalSupply();
    5610            [ # ]:          99 :             if (supply > maxSupply) {
    5611                 :           0 :                 revert ERC20ExceededCap(supply, maxSupply);
    5612                 :             :             }
    5613                 :             :         }
    5614                 :             :     }
    5615                 :             : }

    5635                 :             : /**
    5636                 :             :  * @title IOAppCore
    5637                 :             :  */
    5638                 :             : interface IOAppCore {
    5639                 :             :     // Custom error messages
    5640                 :             :     error OnlyPeer(uint32 eid, bytes32 sender);

    5642                 :             :     error InvalidEndpointCall();

    5646                 :             :     event PeerSet(uint32 eid, bytes32 peer);
    5647                 :             : 
    5648                 :             :     /**
    5649                 :             :      * @notice Retrieves the OApp version information.

    5651                 :             :      * @return receiverVersion The version of the OAppReceiver.sol contract.
    5652                 :             :      */
