    5654                 :             : 
    5655                 :             :     /**
    5656                 :             :      * @notice Retrieves the LayerZero endpoint associated with the OApp.
    5657                 :             :      * @return iEndpoint The LayerZero endpoint as an interface.
    5658                 :             :      */
    5659                 :             :     function endpoint() external view returns (ILayerZeroEndpointV2 iEndpoint);
    5660                 :             : 
    5661                 :             :     /**
    5662                 :             :      * @notice Retrieves the peer (OApp) associated with a corresponding endpoint.
    5663                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    5664                 :             :      * @return peer The peer address (OApp instance) associated with the corresponding endpoint.
    5665                 :             :      */
    5666                 :             :     function peers(uint32 _eid) external view returns (bytes32 peer);
    5667                 :             : 
    5668                 :             :     /**
    5669                 :             :      * @notice Sets the peer address (OApp instance) for a corresponding endpoint.
    5670                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    5671                 :             :      * @param _peer The address of the peer to be associated with the corresponding endpoint.
    5672                 :             :      */
    5673                 :             :     function setPeer(uint32 _eid, bytes32 _peer) external;
    5674                 :             : 
    5675                 :             :     /**
    5676                 :             :      * @notice Sets the delegate address for the OApp Core.
    5677                 :             :      * @param _delegate The address of the delegate to be set.
    5678                 :             :      */
    5679                 :             :     function setDelegate(address _delegate) external;
    5680                 :             : }
    5681                 :             : 
    5682                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/cryptography/MessageHashUtils.sol
    5683                 :             : 
    5684                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.1.0) (utils/cryptography/MessageHashUtils.sol)
    5685                 :             : 
    5686                 :             : /**
    5687                 :             :  * @dev Signature message hash utilities for producing digests to be consumed by {ECDSA} recovery or signing.
    5688                 :             :  *
    5689                 :             :  * The library provides methods for generating a hash of a message that conforms to the
    5690                 :             :  * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-191[ERC-191] and https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712[EIP 712]
    5691                 :             :  * specifications.
    5692                 :             :  */
    5693                 :             : library MessageHashUtils {
    5694                 :             :     /**
    5695                 :             :      * @dev Returns the keccak256 digest of an ERC-191 signed data with version
    5696                 :             :      * `0x45` (`personal_sign` messages).
    5697                 :             :      *
    5698                 :             :      * The digest is calculated by prefixing a bytes32 `messageHash` with
    5699                 :             :      * `"\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n32"` and hashing the result. It corresponds with the
    5700                 :             :      * hash signed when using the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_sign[`eth_sign`] JSON-RPC method.
    5701                 :             :      *
    5702                 :             :      * NOTE: The `messageHash` parameter is intended to be the result of hashing a raw message with
    5703                 :             :      * keccak256, although any bytes32 value can be safely used because the final digest will
    5704                 :             :      * be re-hashed.
    5705                 :             :      *
    5706                 :             :      * See {ECDSA-recover}.
    5707                 :             :      */
    5708                 :           0 :     function toEthSignedMessageHash(bytes32 messageHash) internal pure returns (bytes32 digest) {
    5709                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5710                 :           0 :             mstore(0x00, "\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n32") // 32 is the bytes-length of messageHash
    5711                 :           0 :             mstore(0x1c, messageHash) // 0x1c (28) is the length of the prefix
    5712                 :           0 :             digest := keccak256(0x00, 0x3c) // 0x3c is the length of the prefix (0x1c) + messageHash (0x20)
    5713                 :             :         }
    5714                 :             :     }
    5715                 :             : 
    5716                 :             :     /**
    5717                 :             :      * @dev Returns the keccak256 digest of an ERC-191 signed data with version
    5718                 :             :      * `0x45` (`personal_sign` messages).
    5719                 :             :      *
    5720                 :             :      * The digest is calculated by prefixing an arbitrary `message` with
    5721                 :             :      * `"\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + len(message)` and hashing the result. It corresponds with the
    5722                 :             :      * hash signed when using the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_sign[`eth_sign`] JSON-RPC method.
    5723                 :             :      *
    5724                 :             :      * See {ECDSA-recover}.
    5725                 :             :      */
    5726                 :           0 :     function toEthSignedMessageHash(bytes memory message) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
    5727                 :           0 :         return
    5728                 :           0 :             keccak256(bytes.concat("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n", bytes(Strings.toString(message.length)), message));
    5729                 :             :     }
    5730                 :             : 
    5731                 :             :     /**
    5732                 :             :      * @dev Returns the keccak256 digest of an ERC-191 signed data with version
    5733                 :             :      * `0x00` (data with intended validator).
    5734                 :             :      *
    5735                 :             :      * The digest is calculated by prefixing an arbitrary `data` with `"\x19\x00"` and the intended
    5736                 :             :      * `validator` address. Then hashing the result.
    5737                 :             :      *
    5738                 :             :      * See {ECDSA-recover}.
    5739                 :             :      */
    5740                 :           0 :     function toDataWithIntendedValidatorHash(address validator, bytes memory data) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
    5741                 :           0 :         return keccak256(abi.encodePacked(hex"19_00", validator, data));
    5742                 :             :     }
    5743                 :             : 
    5744                 :             :     /**
    5745                 :             :      * @dev Returns the keccak256 digest of an EIP-712 typed data (ERC-191 version `0x01`).
    5746                 :             :      *
    5747                 :             :      * The digest is calculated from a `domainSeparator` and a `structHash`, by prefixing them with
    5748                 :             :      * `\x19\x01` and hashing the result. It corresponds to the hash signed by the
    5749                 :             :      * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712[`eth_signTypedData`] JSON-RPC method as part of EIP-712.
    5750                 :             :      *
    5751                 :             :      * See {ECDSA-recover}.
    5752                 :             :      */
    5753                 :           0 :     function toTypedDataHash(bytes32 domainSeparator, bytes32 structHash) internal pure returns (bytes32 digest) {
    5754                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5755                 :           0 :             let ptr := mload(0x40)
    5756                 :           0 :             mstore(ptr, hex"19_01")
    5757                 :           0 :             mstore(add(ptr, 0x02), domainSeparator)
    5758                 :           0 :             mstore(add(ptr, 0x22), structHash)
    5759                 :           0 :             digest := keccak256(ptr, 0x42)
    5760                 :             :         }
    5761                 :             :     }
    5762                 :             : }
    5763                 :             : 
    5764                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol
    5765                 :             : 
    5766                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.2.0) (token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol)
    5767                 :             : 
    5768                 :             : /**
    5769                 :             :  * @title SafeERC20
    5770                 :             :  * @dev Wrappers around ERC-20 operations that throw on failure (when the token
    5771                 :             :  * contract returns false). Tokens that return no value (and instead revert or
    5772                 :             :  * throw on failure) are also supported, non-reverting calls are assumed to be
    5773                 :             :  * successful.
    5774                 :             :  * To use this library you can add a `using SafeERC20 for IERC20;` statement to your contract,
    5775                 :             :  * which allows you to call the safe operations as `token.safeTransfer(...)`, etc.
    5776                 :             :  */
    5777                 :             : library SafeERC20 {
    5778                 :             :     /**
    5779                 :             :      * @dev An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.
    5780                 :             :      */
    5781                 :             :     error SafeERC20FailedOperation(address token);
    5782                 :             : 
    5783                 :             :     /**
    5784                 :             :      * @dev Indicates a failed `decreaseAllowance` request.
    5785                 :             :      */
    5786                 :             :     error SafeERC20FailedDecreaseAllowance(address spender, uint256 currentAllowance, uint256 requestedDecrease);
    5787                 :             : 
    5788                 :             :     /**
    5789                 :             :      * @dev Transfer `value` amount of `token` from the calling contract to `to`. If `token` returns no value,
    5790                 :             :      * non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful.
    5791                 :             :      */
    5792                 :           0 :     function safeTransfer(IERC20 token, address to, uint256 value) internal {
    5793                 :           0 :         _callOptionalReturn(token, abi.encodeCall(token.transfer, (to, value)));
    5794                 :             :     }
    5795                 :             : 
    5796                 :             :     /**
    5797                 :             :      * @dev Transfer `value` amount of `token` from `from` to `to`, spending the approval given by `from` to the
    5798                 :             :      * calling contract. If `token` returns no value, non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful.
    5799                 :             :      */
    5800                 :           0 :     function safeTransferFrom(IERC20 token, address from, address to, uint256 value) internal {
    5801                 :           0 :         _callOptionalReturn(token, abi.encodeCall(token.transferFrom, (from, to, value)));
    5802                 :             :     }
    5803                 :             : 
    5804                 :             :     /**
    5805                 :             :      * @dev Increase the calling contract's allowance toward `spender` by `value`. If `token` returns no value,
    5806                 :             :      * non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful.
    5807                 :             :      *
    5808                 :             :      * IMPORTANT: If the token implements ERC-7674 (ERC-20 with temporary allowance), and if the "client"
    5809                 :             :      * smart contract uses ERC-7674 to set temporary allowances, then the "client" smart contract should avoid using
    5810                 :             :      * this function. Performing a {safeIncreaseAllowance} or {safeDecreaseAllowance} operation on a token contract
    5811                 :             :      * that has a non-zero temporary allowance (for that particular owner-spender) will result in unexpected behavior.
    5812                 :             :      */
    5813                 :           0 :     function safeIncreaseAllowance(IERC20 token, address spender, uint256 value) internal {
    5814                 :           0 :         uint256 oldAllowance = token.allowance(address(this), spender);
    5815                 :           0 :         forceApprove(token, spender, oldAllowance + value);
    5816                 :             :     }
    5817                 :             : 
    5818                 :             :     /**
    5819                 :             :      * @dev Decrease the calling contract's allowance toward `spender` by `requestedDecrease`. If `token` returns no
    5820                 :             :      * value, non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful.
    5821                 :             :      *
    5822                 :             :      * IMPORTANT: If the token implements ERC-7674 (ERC-20 with temporary allowance), and if the "client"
    5823                 :             :      * smart contract uses ERC-7674 to set temporary allowances, then the "client" smart contract should avoid using
    5824                 :             :      * this function. Performing a {safeIncreaseAllowance} or {safeDecreaseAllowance} operation on a token contract
    5825                 :             :      * that has a non-zero temporary allowance (for that particular owner-spender) will result in unexpected behavior.
    5826                 :             :      */
    5827                 :           0 :     function safeDecreaseAllowance(IERC20 token, address spender, uint256 requestedDecrease) internal {
    5828                 :             :         unchecked {
    5829                 :           0 :             uint256 currentAllowance = token.allowance(address(this), spender);
    5830            [ # ]:           0 :             if (currentAllowance < requestedDecrease) {
    5831                 :           0 :                 revert SafeERC20FailedDecreaseAllowance(spender, currentAllowance, requestedDecrease);
    5832                 :             :             }
    5833                 :           0 :             forceApprove(token, spender, currentAllowance - requestedDecrease);
    5834                 :             :         }
    5835                 :             :     }
    5836                 :             : 
    5837                 :             :     /**
    5838                 :             :      * @dev Set the calling contract's allowance toward `spender` to `value`. If `token` returns no value,
    5839                 :             :      * non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful. Meant to be used with tokens that require the approval
    5840                 :             :      * to be set to zero before setting it to a non-zero value, such as USDT.
    5841                 :             :      *
    5842                 :             :      * NOTE: If the token implements ERC-7674, this function will not modify any temporary allowance. This function
    5843                 :             :      * only sets the "standard" allowance. Any temporary allowance will remain active, in addition to the value being
    5844                 :             :      * set here.
    5845                 :             :      */
    5846                 :           0 :     function forceApprove(IERC20 token, address spender, uint256 value) internal {
    5847                 :           0 :         bytes memory approvalCall = abi.encodeCall(token.approve, (spender, value));
    5848                 :             : 
    5849            [ # ]:           0 :         if (!_callOptionalReturnBool(token, approvalCall)) {
    5850                 :           0 :             _callOptionalReturn(token, abi.encodeCall(token.approve, (spender, 0)));
    5851                 :           0 :             _callOptionalReturn(token, approvalCall);
    5852                 :             :         }
    5853                 :             :     }
    5854                 :             : 
    5855                 :             :     /**
    5856                 :             :      * @dev Performs an {ERC1363} transferAndCall, with a fallback to the simple {ERC20} transfer if the target has no
    5857                 :             :      * code. This can be used to implement an {ERC721}-like safe transfer that rely on {ERC1363} checks when
    5858                 :             :      * targeting contracts.
    5859                 :             :      *
    5860                 :             :      * Reverts if the returned value is other than `true`.
    5861                 :             :      */
    5862                 :           0 :     function transferAndCallRelaxed(IERC1363 token, address to, uint256 value, bytes memory data) internal {
    5863         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (to.code.length == 0) {
    5864                 :           0 :             safeTransfer(token, to, value);
    5865            [ # ]:           0 :         } else if (!token.transferAndCall(to, value, data)) {
    5866                 :           0 :             revert SafeERC20FailedOperation(address(token));
    5867                 :             :         }
    5868                 :             :     }
    5869                 :             : 
    5870                 :             :     /**
    5871                 :             :      * @dev Performs an {ERC1363} transferFromAndCall, with a fallback to the simple {ERC20} transferFrom if the target
    5872                 :             :      * has no code. This can be used to implement an {ERC721}-like safe transfer that rely on {ERC1363} checks when
    5873                 :             :      * targeting contracts.
    5874                 :             :      *
    5875                 :             :      * Reverts if the returned value is other than `true`.
    5876                 :             :      */
    5877                 :           0 :     function transferFromAndCallRelaxed(
    5878                 :             :         IERC1363 token,
    5879                 :             :         address from,
    5880                 :             :         address to,
    5881                 :             :         uint256 value,
    5882                 :             :         bytes memory data
    5883                 :             :     ) internal {
    5884         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (to.code.length == 0) {
    5885                 :           0 :             safeTransferFrom(token, from, to, value);
    5886            [ # ]:           0 :         } else if (!token.transferFromAndCall(from, to, value, data)) {
    5887                 :           0 :             revert SafeERC20FailedOperation(address(token));
    5888                 :             :         }
    5889                 :             :     }
    5890                 :             : 
    5891                 :             :     /**
    5892                 :             :      * @dev Performs an {ERC1363} approveAndCall, with a fallback to the simple {ERC20} approve if the target has no
    5893                 :             :      * code. This can be used to implement an {ERC721}-like safe transfer that rely on {ERC1363} checks when
    5894                 :             :      * targeting contracts.
    5895                 :             :      *
    5896                 :             :      * NOTE: When the recipient address (`to`) has no code (i.e. is an EOA), this function behaves as {forceApprove}.
    5897                 :             :      * Opposedly, when the recipient address (`to`) has code, this function only attempts to call {ERC1363-approveAndCall}
    5898                 :             :      * once without retrying, and relies on the returned value to be true.
    5899                 :             :      *
    5900                 :             :      * Reverts if the returned value is other than `true`.
    5901                 :             :      */
    5902                 :           0 :     function approveAndCallRelaxed(IERC1363 token, address to, uint256 value, bytes memory data) internal {
    5903         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (to.code.length == 0) {
    5904                 :           0 :             forceApprove(token, to, value);
    5905            [ # ]:           0 :         } else if (!token.approveAndCall(to, value, data)) {
    5906                 :           0 :             revert SafeERC20FailedOperation(address(token));
    5907                 :             :         }
    5908                 :             :     }
    5909                 :             : 
    5910                 :             :     /**
    5911                 :             :      * @dev Imitates a Solidity high-level call (i.e. a regular function call to a contract), relaxing the requirement
    5912                 :             :      * on the return value: the return value is optional (but if data is returned, it must not be false).
    5913                 :             :      * @param token The token targeted by the call.
    5914                 :             :      * @param data The call data (encoded using abi.encode or one of its variants).
    5915                 :             :      *
    5916                 :             :      * This is a variant of {_callOptionalReturnBool} that reverts if call fails to meet the requirements.
    5917                 :             :      */
    5918                 :           0 :     function _callOptionalReturn(IERC20 token, bytes memory data) private {
    5919                 :           0 :         uint256 returnSize;
    5920                 :           0 :         uint256 returnValue;
    5921                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5922                 :           0 :             let success := call(gas(), token, 0, add(data, 0x20), mload(data), 0, 0x20)
    5923                 :             :             // bubble errors
    5924            [ # ]:           0 :             if iszero(success) {
    5925                 :           0 :                 let ptr := mload(0x40)
    5926                 :           0 :                 returndatacopy(ptr, 0, returndatasize())
    5927                 :           0 :                 revert(ptr, returndatasize())
    5928                 :             :             }
    5929                 :           0 :             returnSize := returndatasize()
    5930                 :           0 :             returnValue := mload(0)
    5931                 :             :         }
    5932                 :             : 
    5933            [ # ]:           0 :         if (returnSize == 0 ? address(token).code.length == 0 : returnValue != 1) {
    5934                 :           0 :             revert SafeERC20FailedOperation(address(token));
    5935                 :             :         }
    5936                 :             :     }
    5937                 :             : 
    5938                 :             :     /**
    5939                 :             :      * @dev Imitates a Solidity high-level call (i.e. a regular function call to a contract), relaxing the requirement
    5940                 :             :      * on the return value: the return value is optional (but if data is returned, it must not be false).
    5941                 :             :      * @param token The token targeted by the call.
    5942                 :             :      * @param data The call data (encoded using abi.encode or one of its variants).
    5943                 :             :      *
    5944                 :             :      * This is a variant of {_callOptionalReturn} that silently catches all reverts and returns a bool instead.
    5945                 :             :      */
    5946                 :           0 :     function _callOptionalReturnBool(IERC20 token, bytes memory data) private returns (bool) {
    5947                 :           0 :         bool success;
    5948                 :           0 :         uint256 returnSize;
    5949                 :           0 :         uint256 returnValue;
    5950                 :             :         assembly ("memory-safe") {
    5951                 :           0 :             success := call(gas(), token, 0, add(data, 0x20), mload(data), 0, 0x20)
    5952                 :           0 :             returnSize := returndatasize()
    5953                 :           0 :             returnValue := mload(0)
    5954                 :             :         }
    5955                 :           0 :         return success && (returnSize == 0 ? address(token).code.length > 0 : returnValue == 1);
    5956                 :             :     }
    5957                 :             : }

    5961                 :             : interface IOAppReceiver is ILayerZeroReceiver {
    5962                 :             :     /**
    5963                 :             :      * @notice Indicates whether an address is an approved composeMsg sender to the Endpoint.
    5964                 :             :      * @param _origin The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.
    5965                 :             :      *  - srcEid: The source chain endpoint ID.
    5966                 :             :      *  - sender: The sender address on the src chain.
    5967                 :             :      *  - nonce: The nonce of the message.
    5968                 :             :      * @param _message The lzReceive payload.
    5969                 :             :      * @param _sender The sender address.
    5970                 :             :      * @return isSender Is a valid sender.
    5971                 :             :      *
    5972                 :             :      * @dev Applications can optionally choose to implement a separate composeMsg sender that is NOT the bridging layer.
    5973                 :             :      * @dev The default sender IS the OAppReceiver implementer.
    5974                 :             :      */

    5977                 :             :         bytes calldata _message,
    5978                 :             :         address _sender

    6013                 :             : 
    6014                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/oapp-evm/contracts/oapp/OAppCore.sol
    6015                 :             : 
    6016                 :             : /**
    6017                 :             :  * @title OAppCore
    6018                 :             :  * @dev Abstract contract implementing the IOAppCore interface with basic OApp configurations.
    6019                 :             :  */
    6020                 :             : abstract contract OAppCore is IOAppCore, Ownable {
    6021                 :             :     // The LayerZero endpoint associated with the given OApp
    6022                 :             :     ILayerZeroEndpointV2 public immutable endpoint;
    6023                 :             : 
    6024                 :             :     // Mapping to store peers associated with corresponding endpoints
    6025                 :             :     mapping(uint32 eid => bytes32 peer) public peers;
    6026                 :             : 
    6027                 :             :     /**
    6028                 :             :      * @dev Constructor to initialize the OAppCore with the provided endpoint and delegate.
    6029                 :             :      * @param _endpoint The address of the LOCAL Layer Zero endpoint.
    6030                 :             :      * @param _delegate The delegate capable of making OApp configurations inside of the endpoint.
    6031                 :             :      *
    6032                 :             :      * @dev The delegate typically should be set as the owner of the contract.
    6033                 :             :      */
    6034                 :          58 :     constructor(address _endpoint, address _delegate) {
    6035                 :          58 :         endpoint = ILayerZeroEndpointV2(_endpoint);
    6036                 :             : 
    6037            [ # ]:          58 :         if (_delegate == address(0)) revert InvalidDelegate();
    6038                 :          58 :         endpoint.setDelegate(_delegate);
    6039                 :             :     }
    6040                 :             : 
    6041                 :             :     /**
    6042                 :             :      * @notice Sets the peer address (OApp instance) for a corresponding endpoint.
    6043                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    6044                 :             :      * @param _peer The address of the peer to be associated with the corresponding endpoint.
    6045                 :             :      *
    6046                 :             :      * @dev Only the owner/admin of the OApp can call this function.
    6047                 :             :      * @dev Indicates that the peer is trusted to send LayerZero messages to this OApp.
    6048                 :             :      * @dev Set this to bytes32(0) to remove the peer address.
    6049                 :             :      * @dev Peer is a bytes32 to accommodate non-evm chains.
    6050                 :             :      */
    6051                 :           0 :     function setPeer(uint32 _eid, bytes32 _peer) public virtual onlyOwner {
    6052                 :           0 :         _setPeer(_eid, _peer);
    6053                 :             :     }
    6054                 :             : 
    6055                 :             :     /**
    6056                 :             :      * @notice Sets the peer address (OApp instance) for a corresponding endpoint.
    6057                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    6058                 :             :      * @param _peer The address of the peer to be associated with the corresponding endpoint.
    6059                 :             :      *
    6060                 :             :      * @dev Indicates that the peer is trusted to send LayerZero messages to this OApp.
    6061                 :             :      * @dev Set this to bytes32(0) to remove the peer address.
    6062                 :             :      * @dev Peer is a bytes32 to accommodate non-evm chains.
    6063                 :             :      */
    6064                 :           0 :     function _setPeer(uint32 _eid, bytes32 _peer) internal virtual {
    6065                 :           0 :         peers[_eid] = _peer;
    6066                 :           0 :         emit PeerSet(_eid, _peer);
    6067                 :             :     }
    6068                 :             : 
    6069                 :             :     /**
    6070                 :             :      * @notice Internal function to get the peer address associated with a specific endpoint; reverts if NOT set.
    6071                 :             :      * ie. the peer is set to bytes32(0).
    6072                 :             :      * @param _eid The endpoint ID.
    6073                 :             :      * @return peer The address of the peer associated with the specified endpoint.
    6074                 :             :      */
    6075                 :           0 :     function _getPeerOrRevert(uint32 _eid) internal view virtual returns (bytes32) {
    6076                 :           0 :         bytes32 peer = peers[_eid];
    6077            [ # ]:           0 :         if (peer == bytes32(0)) revert NoPeer(_eid);
    6078                 :           0 :         return peer;
    6079                 :             :     }
    6080                 :             : 
    6081                 :             :     /**
    6082                 :             :      * @notice Sets the delegate address for the OApp.
    6083                 :             :      * @param _delegate The address of the delegate to be set.

    6086                 :             :      * @dev Provides the ability for a delegate to set configs, on behalf of the OApp, directly on the Endpoint contract.
    6087                 :             :      */
    6088                 :           0 :     function setDelegate(address _delegate) public onlyOwner {
    6089                 :           0 :         endpoint.setDelegate(_delegate);

    6091                 :             : }
    6092                 :             : 
    6093                 :             : // node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/cryptography/EIP712.sol
    6094                 :             : 
    6095                 :             : // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.1.0) (utils/cryptography/EIP712.sol)
    6096                 :             : 
    6097                 :             : /**
    6098                 :             :  * @dev https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712[EIP-712] is a standard for hashing and signing of typed structured data.
    6099                 :             :  *
    6100                 :             :  * The encoding scheme specified in the EIP requires a domain separator and a hash of the typed structured data, whose
    6101                 :             :  * encoding is very generic and therefore its implementation in Solidity is not feasible, thus this contract
    6102                 :             :  * does not implement the encoding itself. Protocols need to implement the type-specific encoding they need in order to
    6103                 :             :  * produce the hash of their typed data using a combination of `abi.encode` and `keccak256`.
    6104                 :             :  *
    6105                 :             :  * This contract implements the EIP-712 domain separator ({_domainSeparatorV4}) that is used as part of the encoding
    6106                 :             :  * scheme, and the final step of the encoding to obtain the message digest that is then signed via ECDSA
    6107                 :             :  * ({_hashTypedDataV4}).
    6108                 :             :  *
    6109                 :             :  * The implementation of the domain separator was designed to be as efficient as possible while still properly updating
    6110                 :             :  * the chain id to protect against replay attacks on an eventual fork of the chain.
    6111                 :             :  *
    6112                 :             :  * NOTE: This contract implements the version of the encoding known as "v4", as implemented by the JSON RPC method
    6113                 :             :  * https://docs.metamask.io/guide/signing-data.html[`eth_signTypedDataV4` in MetaMask].
    6114                 :             :  *
    6115                 :             :  * NOTE: In the upgradeable version of this contract, the cached values will correspond to the address, and the domain
    6116                 :             :  * separator of the implementation contract. This will cause the {_domainSeparatorV4} function to always rebuild the
    6117                 :             :  * separator from the immutable values, which is cheaper than accessing a cached version in cold storage.
    6118                 :             :  *
    6119                 :             :  * @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow state-variable-immutable
    6120                 :             :  */
    6121                 :             : abstract contract EIP712 is IERC5267 {
    6122                 :             :     using ShortStrings for *;
    6123                 :             : 
    6124                 :             :     bytes32 private constant TYPE_HASH =
    6125                 :             :         keccak256("EIP712Domain(string name,string version,uint256 chainId,address verifyingContract)");
    6126                 :             : 
    6127                 :             :     // Cache the domain separator as an immutable value, but also store the chain id that it corresponds to, in order to
    6128                 :             :     // invalidate the cached domain separator if the chain id changes.
    6129                 :             :     bytes32 private immutable _cachedDomainSeparator;
    6130                 :             :     uint256 private immutable _cachedChainId;
    6131                 :             :     address private immutable _cachedThis;
    6132                 :             : 
    6133                 :             :     bytes32 private immutable _hashedName;
    6134                 :             :     bytes32 private immutable _hashedVersion;
    6135                 :             : 
    6136                 :             :     ShortString private immutable _name;
    6137                 :             :     ShortString private immutable _version;
    6138                 :             :     string private _nameFallback;
    6139                 :             :     string private _versionFallback;
    6140                 :             : 
    6141                 :             :     /**
    6142                 :             :      * @dev Initializes the domain separator and parameter caches.
    6143                 :             :      *
    6144                 :             :      * The meaning of `name` and `version` is specified in
    6145                 :             :      * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712#definition-of-domainseparator[EIP-712]:
    6146                 :             :      *
    6147                 :             :      * - `name`: the user readable name of the signing domain, i.e. the name of the DApp or the protocol.
    6148                 :             :      * - `version`: the current major version of the signing domain.
    6149                 :             :      *
    6150                 :             :      * NOTE: These parameters cannot be changed except through a xref:learn::upgrading-smart-contracts.adoc[smart
    6151                 :             :      * contract upgrade].
    6152                 :             :      */
    6153                 :          58 :     constructor(string memory name, string memory version) {
    6154                 :          58 :         _name = name.toShortStringWithFallback(_nameFallback);
    6155                 :          58 :         _version = version.toShortStringWithFallback(_versionFallback);
    6156                 :          58 :         _hashedName = keccak256(bytes(name));
    6157                 :          58 :         _hashedVersion = keccak256(bytes(version));
    6158                 :             : 
    6159                 :          58 :         _cachedChainId = block.chainid;
    6160                 :          58 :         _cachedDomainSeparator = _buildDomainSeparator();
    6161                 :          58 :         _cachedThis = address(this);
    6162                 :             :     }
    6163                 :             : 
    6164                 :             :     /**
    6165                 :             :      * @dev Returns the domain separator for the current chain.
    6166                 :             :      */
    6167                 :           0 :     function _domainSeparatorV4() internal view returns (bytes32) {
    6168         [ #  # ]:           0 :         if (address(this) == _cachedThis && block.chainid == _cachedChainId) {
    6169                 :           0 :             return _cachedDomainSeparator;
    6170                 :             :         } else {
    6171                 :           0 :             return _buildDomainSeparator();
    6172                 :             :         }
    6173                 :             :     }
    6174                 :             : 
    6175                 :          58 :     function _buildDomainSeparator() private view returns (bytes32) {
    6176                 :          58 :         return keccak256(abi.encode(TYPE_HASH, _hashedName, _hashedVersion, block.chainid, address(this)));
    6177                 :             :     }
    6178                 :             : 
    6179                 :             :     /**
    6180                 :             :      * @dev Given an already https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712#definition-of-hashstruct[hashed struct], this
    6181                 :             :      * function returns the hash of the fully encoded EIP712 message for this domain.
    6182                 :             :      *
    6183                 :             :      * This hash can be used together with {ECDSA-recover} to obtain the signer of a message. For example:
    6184                 :             :      *
    6185                 :             :      * ```solidity
    6186                 :             :      * bytes32 digest = _hashTypedDataV4(keccak256(abi.encode(
    6187                 :             :      *     keccak256("Mail(address to,string contents)"),
    6188                 :             :      *     mailTo,
    6189                 :             :      *     keccak256(bytes(mailContents))
    6190                 :             :      * )));
    6191                 :             :      * address signer = ECDSA.recover(digest, signature);
    6192                 :             :      * ```
    6193                 :             :      */
    6194                 :           0 :     function _hashTypedDataV4(bytes32 structHash) internal view virtual returns (bytes32) {
    6195                 :           0 :         return MessageHashUtils.toTypedDataHash(_domainSeparatorV4(), structHash);
    6196                 :             :     }
    6197                 :             : 
    6198                 :             :     /**
    6199                 :             :      * @dev See {IERC-5267}.
    6200                 :             :      */
    6201                 :           0 :     function eip712Domain()
    6202                 :             :         public
    6203                 :             :         view
    6204                 :             :         virtual
    6205                 :             :         returns (
    6206                 :             :             bytes1 fields,
    6207                 :             :             string memory name,
    6208                 :             :             string memory version,
    6209                 :             :             uint256 chainId,
    6210                 :             :             address verifyingContract,
    6211                 :             :             bytes32 salt,
    6212                 :             :             uint256[] memory extensions
    6213                 :             :         )
    6214                 :             :     {
    6215                 :           0 :         return (
    6216                 :             :             hex"0f", // 01111
    6217                 :             :             _EIP712Name(),
    6218                 :             :             _EIP712Version(),
    6219                 :             :             block.chainid,
    6220                 :             :             address(this),
    6221                 :             :             bytes32(0),
    6222                 :             :             new uint256[](0)
    6223                 :             :         );
    6224                 :             :     }
    6225                 :             : 
    6226                 :             :     /**
    6227                 :             :      * @dev The name parameter for the EIP712 domain.
    6228                 :             :      *
    6229                 :             :      * NOTE: By default this function reads _name which is an immutable value.
    6230                 :             :      * It only reads from storage if necessary (in case the value is too large to fit in a ShortString).
    6231                 :             :      */
    6232                 :             :     // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase
    6233                 :           0 :     function _EIP712Name() internal view returns (string memory) {
    6234                 :           0 :         return _name.toStringWithFallback(_nameFallback);
    6235                 :             :     }
    6236                 :             : 
    6237                 :             :     /**
    6238                 :             :      * @dev The version parameter for the EIP712 domain.
    6239                 :             :      *
    6240                 :             :      * NOTE: By default this function reads _version which is an immutable value.
    6241                 :             :      * It only reads from storage if necessary (in case the value is too large to fit in a ShortString).
    6242                 :             :      */
    6243                 :             :     // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase
    6244                 :           0 :     function _EIP712Version() internal view returns (string memory) {
    6245                 :           0 :         return _version.toStringWithFallback(_versionFallback);
    6246                 :             :     }
    6247                 :             : }
    6248                 :             : 
    6249                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/lz-evm-protocol-v2/contracts/messagelib/libs/PacketV1Codec.sol
    6250                 :             : 
    6251                 :             : library PacketV1Codec {
    6252                 :             :     using AddressCast for address;
    6253                 :             :     using AddressCast for bytes32;
    6254                 :             : 
    6255                 :             :     uint8 internal constant PACKET_VERSION = 1;
    6256                 :             : 
    6257                 :             :     // header (version + nonce + path)
    6258                 :             :     // version
    6259                 :             :     uint256 private constant PACKET_VERSION_OFFSET = 0;
    6260                 :             :     //    nonce
    6261                 :             :     uint256 private constant NONCE_OFFSET = 1;
    6262                 :             :     //    path
    6263                 :             :     uint256 private constant SRC_EID_OFFSET = 9;
    6264                 :             :     uint256 private constant SENDER_OFFSET = 13;
    6265                 :             :     uint256 private constant DST_EID_OFFSET = 45;
    6266                 :             :     uint256 private constant RECEIVER_OFFSET = 49;
    6267                 :             :     // payload (guid + message)
    6268                 :             :     uint256 private constant GUID_OFFSET = 81; // keccak256(nonce + path)
    6269                 :             :     uint256 private constant MESSAGE_OFFSET = 113;
    6270                 :             : 
    6271                 :           0 :     function encode(Packet memory _packet) internal pure returns (bytes memory encodedPacket) {
    6272                 :           0 :         encodedPacket = abi.encodePacked(
    6273                 :             :             PACKET_VERSION,
    6274                 :             :             _packet.nonce,
    6275                 :             :             _packet.srcEid,
    6276                 :             :             _packet.sender.toBytes32(),
    6277                 :             :             _packet.dstEid,
    6278                 :             :             _packet.receiver,
    6279                 :             :             _packet.guid,
    6280                 :             :             _packet.message
    6281                 :             :         );
    6282                 :             :     }
    6283                 :             : 
    6284                 :           0 :     function encodePacketHeader(Packet memory _packet) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
    6285                 :           0 :         return
    6286                 :           0 :             abi.encodePacked(
    6287                 :             :                 PACKET_VERSION,
    6288                 :             :                 _packet.nonce,
    6289                 :             :                 _packet.srcEid,
    6290                 :             :                 _packet.sender.toBytes32(),
    6291                 :             :                 _packet.dstEid,
    6292                 :             :                 _packet.receiver
    6293                 :             :             );
    6294                 :             :     }
    6295                 :             : 
    6296                 :           0 :     function encodePayload(Packet memory _packet) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
    6297                 :           0 :         return abi.encodePacked(_packet.guid, _packet.message);
    6298                 :             :     }
    6299                 :             : 
    6300                 :           0 :     function header(bytes calldata _packet) internal pure returns (bytes calldata) {
    6301                 :           0 :         return _packet[0:GUID_OFFSET];
    6302                 :             :     }
    6303                 :             : 
    6304                 :           0 :     function version(bytes calldata _packet) internal pure returns (uint8) {
    6305                 :           0 :         return uint8(bytes1(_packet[PACKET_VERSION_OFFSET:NONCE_OFFSET]));
    6306                 :             :     }
    6307                 :             : 
    6308                 :           0 :     function nonce(bytes calldata _packet) internal pure returns (uint64) {
    6309                 :           0 :         return uint64(bytes8(_packet[NONCE_OFFSET:SRC_EID_OFFSET]));
    6310                 :             :     }
    6311                 :             : 
    6312                 :           0 :     function srcEid(bytes calldata _packet) internal pure returns (uint32) {

    6314                 :             :     }

    6355                 :             : /**
    6356                 :             :  * @title InboundPacket
    6357                 :             :  * @dev Structure representing an inbound packet received by the contract.
    6358                 :             :  */
    6359                 :             : struct InboundPacket {
    6360                 :             :     Origin origin; // Origin information of the packet.
    6361                 :             :     uint32 dstEid; // Destination endpointId of the packet.
    6362                 :             :     address receiver; // Receiver address for the packet.
    6363                 :             :     bytes32 guid; // Unique identifier of the packet.
    6364                 :             :     uint256 value; // msg.value of the packet.
    6365                 :             :     address executor; // Executor address for the packet.
    6366                 :             :     bytes message; // Message payload of the packet.
    6367                 :             :     bytes extraData; // Additional arbitrary data for the packet.
    6368                 :             : }
    6369                 :             : 
    6370                 :             : /**
    6371                 :             :  * @title PacketDecoder
    6372                 :             :  * @dev Library for decoding LayerZero packets.
    6373                 :             :  */
    6374                 :             : library PacketDecoder {
    6375                 :             :     using PacketV1Codec for bytes;
    6376                 :             : 
    6377                 :             :     /**
    6378                 :             :      * @dev Decode an inbound packet from the given packet data.
    6379                 :             :      * @param _packet The packet data to decode.
    6380                 :             :      * @return packet An InboundPacket struct representing the decoded packet.
    6381                 :             :      */
    6382                 :           0 :     function decode(bytes calldata _packet) internal pure returns (InboundPacket memory packet) {
    6383                 :           0 :         packet.origin = Origin(_packet.srcEid(), _packet.sender(), _packet.nonce());
    6384                 :           0 :         packet.dstEid = _packet.dstEid();
    6385                 :           0 :         packet.receiver = _packet.receiverB20();
    6386                 :           0 :         packet.guid = _packet.guid();
    6387                 :           0 :         packet.message = _packet.message();
    6388                 :             :     }
    6389                 :             : 
    6390                 :             :     /**
    6391                 :             :      * @dev Decode multiple inbound packets from the given packet data and associated message values.
    6392                 :             :      * @param _packets An array of packet data to decode.
    6393                 :             :      * @param _packetMsgValues An array of associated message values for each packet.
    6394                 :             :      * @return packets An array of InboundPacket structs representing the decoded packets.
    6395                 :             :      */
    6396                 :           0 :     function decode(
    6397                 :             :         bytes[] calldata _packets,
    6398                 :             :         uint256[] memory _packetMsgValues
    6399                 :             :     ) internal pure returns (InboundPacket[] memory packets) {
    6400                 :           0 :         packets = new InboundPacket[](_packets.length);
    6401                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = 0; i < _packets.length; i++) {
    6402                 :           0 :             bytes calldata packet = _packets[i];
    6403                 :           0 :             packets[i] = PacketDecoder.decode(packet);
    6404                 :             :             // @dev Allows the verifier to specify the msg.value that gets passed in lzReceive.
    6405                 :           0 :             packets[i].value = _packetMsgValues[i];
    6406                 :             :         }
    6407                 :             :     }
    6408                 :             : }

    6410                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/oapp-evm/contracts/precrime/interfaces/IOAppPreCrimeSimulator.sol

    6463                 :             : // node_modules/@layerzerolabs/oapp-evm/contracts/oapp/OAppReceiver.sol
    6464                 :             : 
    6465                 :             : /**
    6466                 :             :  * @title OAppReceiver
    6467                 :             :  * @dev Abstract contract implementing the ILayerZeroReceiver interface and extending OAppCore for OApp receivers.
    6468                 :             :  */
    6469                 :             : abstract contract OAppReceiver is IOAppReceiver, OAppCore {
    6470                 :             :     // Custom error message for when the caller is not the registered endpoint/
    6471                 :             :     error OnlyEndpoint(address addr);
    6472                 :             : 
    6473                 :             :     // @dev The version of the OAppReceiver implementation.
    6474                 :             :     // @dev Version is bumped when changes are made to this contract.
    6475                 :             :     uint64 internal constant RECEIVER_VERSION = 2;
    6476                 :             : 
    6477                 :             :     /**
    6478                 :             :      * @notice Retrieves the OApp version information.
    6479                 :             :      * @return senderVersion The version of the OAppSender.sol contract.
    6480                 :             :      * @return receiverVersion The version of the OAppReceiver.sol contract.
    6481                 :             :      *
    6482                 :             :      * @dev Providing 0 as the default for OAppSender version. Indicates that the OAppSender is not implemented.
    6483                 :             :      * ie. this is a RECEIVE only OApp.
    6484                 :             :      * @dev If the OApp uses both OAppSender and OAppReceiver, then this needs to be override returning the correct versions.
    6485                 :             :      */
    6486                 :           0 :     function oAppVersion() public view virtual returns (uint64 senderVersion, uint64 receiverVersion) {
    6487                 :           0 :         return (0, RECEIVER_VERSION);
    6488                 :             :     }
    6489                 :             : 
    6490                 :             :     /**
    6491                 :             :      * @notice Indicates whether an address is an approved composeMsg sender to the Endpoint.
    6492                 :             :      * @dev _origin The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.
    6493                 :             :      *  - srcEid: The source chain endpoint ID.
    6494                 :             :      *  - sender: The sender address on the src chain.
    6495                 :             :      *  - nonce: The nonce of the message.
    6496                 :             :      * @dev _message The lzReceive payload.
    6497                 :             :      * @param _sender The sender address.
    6498                 :             :      * @return isSender Is a valid sender.
    6499                 :             :      *
    6500                 :             :      * @dev Applications can optionally choose to implement separate composeMsg senders that are NOT the bridging layer.
    6501                 :             :      * @dev The default sender IS the OAppReceiver implementer.
    6502                 :             :      */
    6503                 :           0 :     function isComposeMsgSender(
    6504                 :             :         Origin calldata /*_origin*/,
    6505                 :             :         bytes calldata /*_message*/,
    6506                 :             :         address _sender
    6507                 :             :     ) public view virtual returns (bool) {
    6508                 :           0 :         return _sender == address(this);
    6509                 :             :     }
    6510                 :             : 
    6511                 :             :     /**
    6512                 :             :      * @notice Checks if the path initialization is allowed based on the provided origin.
    6513                 :             :      * @param origin The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.
    6514                 :             :      * @return Whether the path has been initialized.
    6515                 :             :      *
    6516                 :             :      * @dev This indicates to the endpoint that the OApp has enabled msgs for this particular path to be received.
    6517                 :             :      * @dev This defaults to assuming if a peer has been set, its initialized.
    6518                 :             :      * Can be overridden by the OApp if there is other logic to determine this.
    6519                 :             :      */
    6520                 :           0 :     function allowInitializePath(Origin calldata origin) public view virtual returns (bool) {
    6521                 :           0 :         return peers[origin.srcEid] == origin.sender;
    6522                 :             :     }
    6523                 :             : 
    6524                 :             :     /**
    6525                 :             :      * @notice Retrieves the next nonce for a given source endpoint and sender address.
    6526                 :             :      * @dev _srcEid The source endpoint ID.
    6527                 :             :      * @dev _sender The sender address.
    6528                 :             :      * @return nonce The next nonce.
    6529                 :             :      *
    6530                 :             :      * @dev The path nonce starts from 1. If 0 is returned it means that there is NO nonce ordered enforcement.
    6531                 :             :      * @dev Is required by the off-chain executor to determine the OApp expects msg execution is ordered.
    6532                 :             :      * @dev This is also enforced by the OApp.
    6533                 :             :      * @dev By default this is NOT enabled. ie. nextNonce is hardcoded to return 0.
    6534                 :             :      */
    6535                 :           0 :     function nextNonce(uint32 /*_srcEid*/, bytes32 /*_sender*/) public view virtual returns (uint64 nonce) {
    6536                 :           0 :         return 0;
    6537                 :             :     }
    6538                 :             : 
    6539                 :             :     /**
    6540                 :             :      * @dev Entry point for receiving messages or packets from the endpoint.
    6541                 :             :      * @param _origin The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.
    6542                 :             :      *  - srcEid: The source chain endpoint ID.
    6543                 :             :      *  - sender: The sender address on the src chain.
    6544                 :             :      *  - nonce: The nonce of the message.
    6545                 :             :      * @param _guid The unique identifier for the received LayerZero message.
    6546                 :             :      * @param _message The payload of the received message.

    6548                 :             :      * @param _extraData Additional arbitrary data provided by the corresponding executor.
    6549                 :             :      *

    6551                 :             :      */
    6552                 :           0 :     function lzReceive(
    6553                 :             :         Origin calldata _origin,
    6554                 :             :         bytes32 _guid,

    6556                 :             :         address _executor,
    6557                 :             :         bytes calldata _extraData

    6559                 :             :         // Ensures that only the endpoint can attempt to lzReceive() messages to this OApp.
    6560            [ # ]:           0 :         if (address(endpoint) != msg.sender) revert OnlyEndpoint(msg.sender);
    6561                 :             : 
    6562                 :             :         // Ensure that the sender matches the expected peer for the source endpoint.

    6564                 :             : 
    6565                 :             :         // Call the internal OApp implementation of lzReceive.
    6566                 :           0 :         _lzReceive(_origin, _guid, _message, _executor, _extraData);

    6583                 :             : /**
    6584                 :             :  * @title OAppPreCrimeSimulator
    6585                 :             :  * @dev Abstract contract serving as the base for preCrime simulation functionality in an OApp.
    6586                 :             :  */
    6587                 :             : abstract contract OAppPreCrimeSimulator is IOAppPreCrimeSimulator, Ownable {
    6588                 :             :     // The address of the preCrime implementation.
    6589                 :             :     address public preCrime;
    6590                 :             : 
    6591                 :             :     /**
    6592                 :             :      * @dev Retrieves the address of the OApp contract.
    6593                 :             :      * @return The address of the OApp contract.
    6594                 :             :      *
    6595                 :             :      * @dev The simulator contract is the base contract for the OApp by default.
    6596                 :             :      * @dev If the simulator is a separate contract, override this function.
    6597                 :             :      */

    6599                 :           0 :         return address(this);
    6600                 :             :     }
    6601                 :             : 
    6602                 :             :     /**
    6603                 :             :      * @dev Sets the preCrime contract address.
    6604                 :             :      * @param _preCrime The address of the preCrime contract.
    6605                 :             :      */
    6606                 :           0 :     function setPreCrime(address _preCrime) public virtual onlyOwner {
    6607                 :           0 :         preCrime = _preCrime;
    6608                 :           0 :         emit PreCrimeSet(_preCrime);
    6609                 :             :     }
    6610                 :             : 
    6611                 :             :     /**
    6612                 :             :      * @dev Interface for pre-crime simulations. Always reverts at the end with the simulation results.
    6613                 :             :      * @param _packets An array of InboundPacket objects representing received packets to be delivered.
    6614                 :             :      *
    6615                 :             :      * @dev WARNING: MUST revert at the end with the simulation results.
    6616                 :             :      * @dev Gives the preCrime implementation the ability to mock sending packets to the lzReceive function,
    6617                 :             :      * WITHOUT actually executing them.
    6618                 :             :      */
    6619                 :           0 :     function lzReceiveAndRevert(InboundPacket[] calldata _packets) public payable virtual {
    6620                 :           0 :         for (uint256 i = 0; i < _packets.length; i++) {
    6621                 :           0 :             InboundPacket calldata packet = _packets[i];
    6622                 :             : 
    6623                 :             :             // Ignore packets that are not from trusted peers.
    6624                 :           0 :             if (!isPeer(packet.origin.srcEid, packet.origin.sender)) continue;
    6625                 :             : 
    6626                 :             :             // @dev Because a verifier is calling this function, it doesnt have access to executor params:
    6627                 :             :             //  - address _executor
    6628                 :             :             //  - bytes calldata _extraData
    6629                 :             :             // preCrime will NOT work for OApps that rely on these two parameters inside of their _lzReceive().
    6630                 :             :             // They are instead stubbed to default values, address(0) and bytes("")
    6631                 :             :             // @dev Calling this.lzReceiveSimulate removes ability for assembly return 0 callstack exit,
    6632                 :             :             // which would cause the revert to be ignored.
    6633                 :           0 :             this.lzReceiveSimulate{ value: packet.value }(
    6634                 :             :                 packet.origin,
    6635                 :             :                 packet.guid,
    6636                 :             :                 packet.message,
    6637                 :             :                 packet.executor,
    6638                 :             :                 packet.extraData
    6639                 :             :             );
    6640                 :             :         }
    6641                 :             : 
    6642                 :             :         // @dev Revert with the simulation results. msg.sender must implement IPreCrime.buildSimulationResult().
    6643                 :           0 :         revert SimulationResult(IPreCrime(msg.sender).buildSimulationResult());
    6644                 :             :     }
    6645                 :             : 
    6646                 :             :     /**
    6647                 :             :      * @dev Is effectively an internal function because msg.sender must be address(this).
    6648                 :             :      * Allows resetting the call stack for 'internal' calls.
    6649                 :             :      * @param _origin The origin information containing the source endpoint and sender address.
    6650                 :             :      *  - srcEid: The source chain endpoint ID.
    6651                 :             :      *  - sender: The sender address on the src chain.
    6652                 :             :      *  - nonce: The nonce of the message.
    6653                 :             :      * @param _guid The unique identifier of the packet.
    6654                 :             :      * @param _message The message payload of the packet.
    6655                 :             :      * @param _executor The executor address for the packet.
    6656                 :             :      * @param _extraData Additional data for the packet.
    6657                 :             :      */
    6658                 :           0 :     function lzReceiveSimulate(
    6659                 :             :         Origin calldata _origin,
    6660                 :             :         bytes32 _guid,
    6661                 :             :         bytes calldata _message,
    6662                 :             :         address _executor,
    6663                 :             :         bytes calldata _extraData
    6664                 :             :     ) external payable virtual {
    6665                 :             :         // @dev Ensure ONLY can be called 'internally'.
    6666            [ # ]:           0 :         if (msg.sender != address(this)) revert OnlySelf();

    6670                 :             :     /**
    6671                 :             :      * @dev Internal function to handle the OAppPreCrimeSimulator simulated receive.

    6683                 :             :      */

    6708                 :             :     using SafeERC20 for IERC20;
    6709                 :             :

    6714                 :             :     // @dev The version of the OAppSender implementation.

    6724                 :             :      * ie. this is a SEND only OApp.
    6725                 :             :      * @dev If the OApp uses both OAppSender and OAppReceiver, then this needs to be override returning the correct versions

    6730                 :             : 
    6731                 :             :     /**

    6754                 :             :     /**

    6763                 :             :      * @return receipt The receipt for the sent message.
    6764                 :             :      *      - guid: The unique identifier for the sent message.
    6765                 :             :      *      - nonce: The nonce of the sent message.
    6766                 :             :      *      - fee: The LayerZero fee incurred for the message.
    6767                 :             :      */
    6768                 :           0 :     function _lzSend(
    6769                 :             :         uint32 _dstEid,
    6770                 :             :         bytes memory _message,
    6771                 :             :         bytes memory _options,
    6772                 :             :         MessagingFee memory _fee,
    6773                 :             :         address _refundAddress
    6774                 :             :     ) internal virtual returns (MessagingReceipt memory receipt) {
    6775                 :             :         // @dev Push corresponding fees to the endpoint, any excess is sent back to the _refundAddress from the endpoint.
    6776                 :           0 :         uint256 messageValue = _payNative(_fee.nativeFee);
    6777            [ # ]:           0 :         if (_fee.lzTokenFee > 0) _payLzToken(_fee.lzTokenFee);
    6778                 :             : 
    6779                 :           0 :         return
    6780                 :             :             // solhint-disable-next-line check-send-result
    6781                 :           0 :             endpoint.send{ value: messageValue }(
    6782                 :             :                 MessagingParams(_dstEid, _getPeerOrRevert(_dstEid), _message, _options, _fee.lzTokenFee > 0),
    6783                 :             :                 _refundAddress
    6784                 :             :             );
    6785                 :             :     }
    6786                 :             : 
    6787                 :             :     /**
    6788                 :             :      * @dev Internal function to pay the native fee associated with the message.
    6789                 :             :      * @param _nativeFee The native fee to be paid.
    6790                 :             :      * @return nativeFee The amount of native currency paid.
    6791                 :             :      *
    6792                 :             :      * @dev If the OApp needs to initiate MULTIPLE LayerZero messages in a single transaction,
    6793                 :             :      * this will need to be overridden because msg.value would contain multiple lzFees.
    6794                 :             :      * @dev Should be overridden in the event the LayerZero endpoint requires a different native currency.
    6795                 :             :      * @dev Some EVMs use an ERC20 as a method for paying transactions/gasFees.
    6796                 :             :      * @dev The endpoint is EITHER/OR, ie. it will NOT support both types of native payment at a time.
    6797                 :             :      */
    6798                 :           0 :     function _payNative(uint256 _nativeFee) internal virtual returns (uint256 nativeFee) {
    6799            [ # ]:           0 :         if (msg.value != _nativeFee) revert NotEnoughNative(msg.value);
    6800                 :           0 :         return _nativeFee;
    6801                 :             :     }
    6802                 :             : 
    6803                 :             :     /**
    6804                 :             :      * @dev Internal function to pay the LZ token fee associated with the message.
    6805                 :             :      * @param _lzTokenFee The LZ token fee to be paid.
    6806                 :             :      *
    6807                 :             :      * @dev If the caller is trying to pay in the specified lzToken, then the lzTokenFee is passed to the endpoint.
    6808                 :             :      * @dev Any excess sent, is passed back to the specified _refundAddress in the _lzSend().
    6809                 :             :      */
    6810                 :           0 :     function _payLzToken(uint256 _lzTokenFee) internal virtual {
    6811                 :             :         // @dev Cannot cache the token because it is not immutable in the endpoint.
    6812                 :           0 :         address lzToken = endpoint.lzToken();
    6813            [ # ]:           0 :         if (lzToken == address(0)) revert LzTokenUnavailable();
    6814                 :             : 
    6815                 :             :         // Pay LZ token fee by sending tokens to the endpoint.
    6816                 :           0 :         IERC20(lzToken).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(endpoint), _lzTokenFee);
    6817                 :             :     }
    6818                 :             : }

    6822                 :             : /**
    6823                 :             :  * @dev Struct representing token parameters for the OFT send() operation.

    6825                 :             : struct SendParam {
    6826                 :             :     uint32 dstEid; // Destination endpoint ID.
    6827                 :             :     bytes32 to; // Recipient address.

    6834                 :             : 
    6835                 :             : /**
    6836                 :             :  * @dev Struct representing OFT limit information.

    6838                 :             :  */
    6839                 :             : struct OFTLimit {
    6840                 :             :     uint256 minAmountLD; // Minimum amount in local decimals that can be sent to the recipient.
    6841                 :             :     uint256 maxAmountLD; // Maximum amount in local decimals that can be sent to the recipient.

    6844                 :             : /**
    6845                 :             :  * @dev Struct representing OFT receipt information.
    6846                 :             :  */
    6847                 :             : struct OFTReceipt {

    6849                 :             :     // @dev In non-default implementations, the amountReceivedLD COULD differ from this value.
    6850                 :             :     uint256 amountReceivedLD; // Amount of tokens to be received on the remote side.
    6851                 :             : }
    6852                 :             : 
    6853                 :             : /**

    6856                 :             :  */
    6857                 :             : struct OFTFeeDetail {
